title: A Real Look Inside BRAC IT: What Many WonтАЩt Say Out Loud
content:
1. Hiring and Promotion ArenтАЩt Always Fair
Despite what the official statement says, many people inside BRAC IT feel that hiring and promotions often depend more on personal connections than merit. Teams, especially under certain leaders, are filled with friends and past colleagues. ThereтАЩs no proper performance review system, so itтАЩs hard to understand how promotions are actually decided.
2. Religious Bias May Not Be тАЬOfficial,тАЭ But ItтАЩs There
BRAC IT claims to be secular, but some leadership members have openly shown atheist views, and a few have even shared anti-Islamic comments in the past. While personal beliefs are private, the way they influence team culture can make others feel uncomfortable or excluded.
3. Speaking Up IsnтАЩt Always Safe or Easy
The company encourages using тАЬproper channelsтАЭ to raise concerns, but what are those, really? Many employees feel thereтАЩs no trusted space to talk about internal problems. Management is aware of these issues but seems unwilling to make changes, and thatтАЩs frustrating when peopleтАЩs careers and livelihoods are at stake. To make things worse, firing people without explanation happens often. We live in constant fear of being let go for no clear reason, and the abuse of power feels like a normal part of the culture.
4. Impact Is Mostly Through BRAC, Not Independent Innovation
BRAC IT often talks about making a difference in Bangladesh, but most of that impact comes from being tied to BRAC. Outside of that, there's little innovation happening. The microfinance project, its main offering- is based on interest, which many employees see as conflicting with ethical or religious values.
5. Criticism ShouldnтАЩt Be Dismissed as Hate
Yes, no one should spread hate or attack others based on faith. But calling all criticism тАЬhate speechтАЭ is a way to shut down real issues. People just want honesty, fairness, and a healthy work culture, things every organization should take seriously.

title: Counterstatement to Misleading and Discriminatory Review on Deshi Mula
content:
We categorically reject the defamatory and inflammatory remarks presented in the review about BRAC IT on Deshi Mula. The statement not only promotes religious intolerance but also undermines the values of diversity and inclusivity.
Here are the facts:

title: Office politics at it's max
content:
You may heard all the golden glorified stories about this company but not it's a total mess. The company owners are busy in foreign travels and their "islamic kaj karbars". Meanwhile, the office became a playground of multi group politics. The whole company now runs by the hr and accounts people, and they dnt hesitate a bit to show this.
If u talk to them for ur own need they will through some made up rules and dismis u right there. If u tends to talk back, they will mark you and they will do whatever is necessary to make ur life he'll there. To survive, u must join a group start "oiling" the seniors.
The only good thing about this company is the salary and bonus. If u care about ur mental health, never apply here. If u care about money, stay with it.

title: Everything is super except salary structure
content:
Pros:
1.Very good work life balance
2. Super friendly coworkers
3.hybrid
4. Updated Technology
Cons:
1. No structure salary
2. Low increment
3.Slow Growth

title: Egotistic and spineless: a combination for imminent disaster
content:
Portonics had a good reputation in the industry as having a good work culture and a tenacity to promote quality. These are the reason why I joined the company initially.
This perception, when met with reality, was shattered as the company has fallen too far from grace. I didn't see any of the perceived qualities in my stay there. What I saw though was promotion of clueless individuals to leadership, long term employees being shunned and discarded like baby diapers (takes all the poop but not valued after use) and worst of all a tech leadership so spineless that the only commitment they care about is to please their egotistical leader. The only thing they can defend is their undying will to please the higher up, even if it means to disregard the suggestion of the team for completely irrational reasons.
All of this is a result of an organisational leadership which is split between two individuals whose methods cannot be any different than each other. One is a methodical and strategic leader with a penchant for overseeing every aspect to the finish line, while the other is an individual who cannot do no wrong. Any and everything that he does is deemed as the best and the employees are just hindering his brilliance. Useless "team building" session of self gloating is deemed as "motivational" for the team from his eyes, while the rest of the team feels it as a waste of time.
Overall majority of the departments are led by individuals who cannot be further from being qualified. The only criteria of being qualified is being favored by the man in charge.
Honestly, the company can be so much better if they just figure out their issues instead of staying in denial and claiming supremacy and also make sure that qualified individuals are leading the departments instead of suck ups and loyalists. We all know how that helped BAL on the long run.Do not recommend this company, even to my enemies. And for those looking for a good work culture, look somewhere else or check if they have actually done something to make things better, instead of claiming it.

title: Toxic Environment, Puppet Leadership & Career Destroyer
content:
Pros:
On-time salary
Thereweresome amazing, talented teammates тАФ but sadly,most of them have already leftdue to the toxic environment
Cons:
Misleading leadership: The CEO celebrates growth all year but suddenly claims losses right before appraisals. ItтАЩs a pattern to deny employees fair raises.
Frequent layoffs: No job security.
Ex-CTO damaged the team culture: His decisions caused major dysfunction, and instead of accountability, it led to mass resignations and layoffs
Now run by unqualified puppets: Many current leaders in key positions haveno experiencein other tech companies.
No learning or growth: With poor leadership and no direction, you will not gain meaningful experience here. ItтАЩs a dead end for any serious tech professional.
Engineers treated like factory workers: No respect for skill, no voice in decision-making.
Even basic office supplies (like tea/coffee) are rationedto save money тАФ a sign of how little the company values its people.
Bottom Line:Truck Lagbe is not a place for growth, innovation, or respect. ItтАЩs a place where good people burn out, careers stall, and toxic politics win.Avoid if you care about your future.

title: Leaders who made the company a living HELL
content:
Portonics was once regarded as a benchmark for company culture and developer experience in Bangladesh. It attracted top talent and fostered an environment where innovation and collaboration thrived. Unfortunately, that chapter seems to have come to a close.
In recent times, the departure of visionary leaders has left the company in the hands of individuals who appear to lack both the technical depth and emotional intelligence necessary to lead. The current leadership seems more concerned with control than with growthтАФboth their own and their teamтАЩs. Rather than empowering developers, they push a culture of overwork, where 12тАУ18 hour days for months on end are considered the norm. Refusing to comply with these unrealistic demands can quickly lead to one being labeled a тАЬlow performer.тАЭ
Perhaps most concerning is the toxic internal politics. Developers are subtly (and at times directly) encouraged to undermine their seniorsтАФnot based on merit or professionalism, but because those seniors pose a perceived threat to insecure leadership. Only exception is the QA Lead , who is the OG member of Portonics and still carries the old essence of the company
While the base salary structure remains competitive and annual increments are decent, the bonus system is poorly thought out and fails to reflect the contributions or sacrifices of the team.
Developers who value integrity, a healthy work-life balance, and a culture of mutual respect may want to think twice before committing to Portonics in its current state. Talented individuals have already begun to move onтАФand unless significant changes are made, that trend is likely to continue.
I was able to leave the company before it became unbearable. Can't say the same for my colleagues, who are still suffering . If you are Planing to join here, don't, trust me .
If you are appearing for the interview, if your skill set is better than the leader, you will be rejected. If your skill is moderate and you are submissive, you will be surely selected

"рж▓рж┐*ржи ржж*: ржмрж╛ржЯржкрж╛рж░рж┐рж░ рж░рж╛ржЬрж╛, ржПржоржкрзНрж▓рзЯрзАржжрзЗрж░ рж░ржХрзНржд ржЪрзБрж╖рзЗ рж╢рзЛрж╖ржгрзЗрж░ ржорж╣рж╛ржпржЬрзНржЮ!""ржЯрзЗржХржирзЛржнрж┐рж╕рж┐ржирж┐ржЯрж┐рж░ 'ржмрж╛ржЯржкрж╛рж░' ржмрж╕ рж▓рж┐*ржи ржж*: ржмрзЗрждржи ржЖржЯржХрзЗ рж░рзЗржЦрзЗ, ржорж┐ржерзНржпрзЗ ржкрзНрж░рж▓рзЛржнржи ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржПржоржкрзНрж▓рзЯрзАржжрзЗрж░ ржаржХрж╛ржирзЛрж░ ржПржХрзНрж╕ржкрж╛рж░рзНржЯ!""рж╢рзЛрж╖ржгрзЗрж░ ржЧрзБрж░рзБ рж▓рж┐*ржи ржж*тАФржирзЗржХрзНрж╕ржЯ рж╕ржкрзНрждрж╛рж╣рзЗрж░ ржлрж╛ржБржжрзЗ ржПржоржкрзНрж▓рзЯрзАржжрзЗрж░ ржмрзЗрждржи рж▓рзБржЯ, ржорж╛ржирж╖рж┐ржХ ржЕрждрзНржпрж╛ржЪрж╛рж░рзЗ ржорж╛рж╕рзНржЯрж╛рж░!""ржирж╛ржорзЗ 'ржж*', ржХрж╛ржЬрзЗ 'ржжрждрзНрждржХ'тАФржПржоржкрзНрж▓рзЯрзАржжрзЗрж░ ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛-рж╕рзНржмржкрзНржи рж╕ржмржЗ рж╣ржЬржо!"ЁЯШП

рж╕рзЗрж▓рж╛рж░рж┐рж░ ржХржерж╛ ржпржжрж┐ ржмрж▓рж┐ ржПржжрзЗрж░ рж╕рзЗрж▓рж╛рж░рж┐ рждрзБрж▓ржирж╛ржорзБрж▓ржХ ржХржоредржХрж┐ржирзНржд ржЗржиржХрзНрж░рж┐ржорзЗржирзНржЯ ржУ ржорзЛржЯрж╛ржорзБржЯрж┐ред ржПржЗ ржХрзЛржорзНржкрж╛ржирж┐ ржорзБрж▓ржд ржорж╛ржЭрж╛рж░рж┐ ржорж╛ржирзЗрж░ ржлрзНрж░рзЗрж╢рж╛рж░ ржбрзЗржнржжрзЗрж░ ржЬржирзНржп ржнрж╛рж▓рзЛредрзи ржмржЫрж░ ржХрж╛ржЬ ржХрж░рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рж▓рзЗ ржХрзНржпрж╛рж░рж┐рзЯрж╛рж░ ржЯрзНрж░тАНрзНржпрж╛ржХрзЗ ржЙржарзЗ ржпрж╛ржмрзЗред

title: BRAC IT тАУ A Playground for Power, Favoritism, and Toxic Culture
content:
These counter-statements show how BRAC IT current management handle feedback, reflecting the mindset of the CEO, the Head of Delivery and Governance, the CTO, and the Head of Employee Experience, QA, and Admin. the CEO and HoD Delivery and Governance often silence employees through direct or indirect threats of termination, creating a culture where speaking up feels risky.
BRAC IT has relied heavily on BRAC as its main client for years. ItтАЩs not competitors damaging your reputation тАУ itтАЩs your own biased practices, favoritism, and internal power struggles.
YouтАЩve created a culture that values loyalty over merit, encouraging small, exclusive groups, free mixing, unprofessional behavior, and ignoring genuine concerns. Instead of building a professional work environment, the focus has shifted to normalizing behaviors like drinking, promoting free mixing, party-like culture, and surrounding yourself with people who support your decisions, right or wrong, rather than those who are genuinely skilled.
The CEO often uses his connections with senior figures of BRAC to avoid accountability, mentioning these links to suppress dissent. The Head of Delivery and Governance, despite having limited leadership skills, was hired to a senior role, largely due to his loyalty to the current acting CEO and personal connections. His past behavior, including reported arrogance and unprofessional conduct, has created a toxic work environment where even female colleagues hesitate to speak up, fearing job insecurity. He reportedly secured his position through personal influence rather than merit, leveraging his network to gain power.
Meanwhile, loyal but unskilled hires are brought in to support the personal agendas of the leadership, creating a culture where real talent is sidelined, and genuine employees are overburdened, handling both their own work and the work of these favored but less competent colleagues.
This toxic culture is eroding the companyтАЩs long-term reputation, making it a place for chilling and enjoyment rather than real work and growth.

title: Why BRAC IT Becoming Selies 2.0 тАУ A Comedy Show in IT World
content:
BRAC IT is not just an IT company anymore. ItтАЩs turning intoSelies 2.0, aka "Revenge of the Nerds тАУ Bangladesh Edition."
Why? Because their CTO, Mr. T**u, came from Selies. And guess what? He brought half the Selies IT team with him тАУ like itтАЩs a picnic, not a company. No qualification check, no skill check тАУ just тАЬBro, come join!тАЭ
ItтАЩs not hiring, itтАЩsтАЬbring your friends to workтАЭ day тАУ every day.
Rumor says T**u had some drama with Selies before. So now heтАЩs turning BRAC IT into a Selies clone, maybe to show тАЬwhoтАЩs boss now.тАЭ It's not IT, it'sIT-vengers: Endgame.
Also, interviews? WhatтАЩs that? BRAC IT doesnтАЩt do interviews if you're from Selies. Just say тАЬSeliesтАЭ and they open the gate like you're VIP.
So now, BRAC IT is not тАЬBetter IT,тАЭ itтАЩs тАЬBudget Selies with extra drama.тАЭ
How to Fix BRAC IT Turning into Selies 2.0 тАУ The Rescue Plan
Okay BRAC IT, donтАЩt panic. You can still stop the тАЬSelies Invasion.тАЭ Here's how to fix it before it becomes a full-blown IT soap opera:
Stop Hiring Like It's a Family PicnicJust because someone worked in Selies doesn't mean theyтАЩre an IT ninja. Use interviews. Real ones. Not тАЬHey bro, you free from Selies? Join BRAC IT!тАЭ
Check Skills, Not Friend ListWant to build a strong team? Try checking CVs and skills, not just if someone was in T**u BhaiтАЩs old gang. A company is not a reunion party.
Create a Real Hiring ProcessInterviews should have questions, not coffee and gossip. HR should be HR, not тАЬOld Selies Club President.тАЭ
Build BRAC IT Identity, Not Selies ReloadedBRAC IT needs its own culture, not a Selies remix. Make it unique, not тАЬSelies with a new logo.тАЭ
Keep Emotions Out of BusinessIf T**u Bhai wants revenge, tell him to play PUBG, not run a company like a revenge drama. Business needs logic, not serial plot twists.
Bring Diversity in TeamMix it up! Get fresh minds, from other companies, even new grads. BRAC IT should look like a tech team, not a Selies reunion photo.

title: Motamuti Kharap na
content:
Beautiful and helpful work environment. Career growth is medium .
Internal politics present in some teams.
QA team run by Females. New junior employees has to work super┬а hard . Used to be a political team but got better after some of the┬а qa left. But politics still there.┬а Mostly do manual test.
App team used to be filled with talented people , now almost all of them are gone only few left. There is not much bonding between seniors and juniors. Leaders are not great at managing . Blame game present
Cloud team looks good from outside especially senior junior bond and┬а run by some good seniors. Not sure about what is inside. Seems no politics.┬а Leaders are good but not excellent. Most talented team of Company now.
Management is also good but not excellent. CTO is a nice guy.
Congested office space is a major issue.
Salary can be better.
Started working on cutting edge technology now.
Work for fortune 500 Companies

title: Worse Company
content:
Pros:
Honestly, there areno real proshere. Besides receiving your basic salary, you get zero additional benefits.
Cons:
The company has inherited all the worst aspects of BJIT culture тАФ unsurprising, since many people here came from there.
No salary or career development framework exists. Promotions are random, and youтАЩll see people with laughable job titles who clearly donтАЩt understand what those titles mean.
The company hastwo CTOs, but theyтАЩre practically invisible. Management never encourages reaching out to them, and they contribute nothing.
Most managers are unqualified and insecure. They avoid hiring competent people out of fear they'll be exposed to upper management.
Career growth depends on sucking up to your manager. If your manager is bad, your life will be miserable тАФ expect unpaid overtime, weekend work, and impossible deadlines.
Work hours are 9 AM to 7 PM minimum тАФ labor laws donтАЩt seem to apply here.
HR is a constant disaster. Salary increments are delayed, and processes are so broken youтАЩll need to fill out the same forms 3тАУ4 times. They say theyтАЩre working on issues тАФ theyтАЩre not.
The new office is in a rural area with no working AC. Employees regularly get sick within a few days of working there.
Suggesting improvements is risky тАФ if your manager doesnтАЩt like your idea, you could be fired. People are frequently let go without reason.
A bunch of random IT guys call themselves тАЬDevOpsтАЭ with almost zero actual knowledge. They follow outdated practices from 20 years ago and resist any modern suggestion. Deployment is a nightmare тАФ you'll have to call them multiple times just to get something pushed to staging.
Overtime is the norm, with no recognition or reward тАФ no tours, no team dinners, no appreciation.
The BA (Business Analyst) team is basically just technical writers. They're afraid to hire anyone new or more competent.
The design team lacks creativity. Most of their work is just copying тАФ no original thought, no innovation.
ThereтАЩs a so-called тАЬSecurity SpecialistтАЭ who gives weekly sessions on generic topics like installing antivirus software or avoiding malware. They have no idea how to deal with real application security, vulnerabilities, or security researchers тАФ just the same basic advice on loop every week.

ржПржЗ ржкрзНрж░рждрж┐рж╖рзНржарж╛ржирзЗnepotism ржЖрж░ favouritism ржПржХржЯрж╛ ржнрзЯржВржХрж░ ржорж╛рждрзНрж░рж╛рзЯ ржкрзМржБржЫрзЗ ржЧрзЗржЫрзЗредржЖржкржирж┐ рж╕рж╛рж░рж╛ ржмржЫрж░ рж╣рж╛рзЬржнрж╛ржЩрж╛ ржЦрж╛ржЯрзБржи, ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржХрзЗржЙ ржжрзЗржЦржмрзЗржУ ржирж╛, ржмрж▓ржмрзЗржУ ржирж╛ред ржЖрж░ ржПржХржЬржи рж╢рзБржзрзБ рж╣рж╛ржУрзЯрж╛ ржЦрзЗрзЯрзЗ ржмрзЗрзЬрж╛рзЯ, рждрж╛рж░ржЗ ржЗржиржХрзНрж░рж┐ржорзЗржирзНржЯ ржмрзЗрж╢рж┐, рждрж╛рж░ржЗ ржкрзНрж░рж╢ржВрж╕рж╛ рж╣рзЯ, рждрж╛рж░ржЗ ржкржжрзЛржирзНржирждрж┐ рж╣рзЯред ржХрзА ржХрж╛рж░ржгрзЗ? ржХрж╛рж░ржг рж╕рзЗ ржХрж╛рж░ржУ рж▓рзЛржХ, ржмрж╛ ржХрж╛рж░ржУ ржкрзБрж░рзЛржирзЛ тАШржмрж┐рж╢рзНржмрж╕рзНрждтАЩ рж╕рзИржирж┐ржХред
рж╕рж┐ржирзНржбрж┐ржХрзЗржЯрзЗ ржнрж░рж╛ ржПржХржЯрж╛ ржЬрж╛рзЯржЧрж╛, ржпрзЗржЦрж╛ржирзЗ ржЯрзЗржХржирзЛрж▓ржЬрж┐ ржЬрж╛ржирж╛рж░ ржЪрзЗрзЯрзЗ рж╕ржорзНржкрж░рзНржХ ржЬрж╛ржирж╛ ржмрзЗрж╢рж┐ ржЬрж░рзБрж░рж┐редржЧрзБрж░рзБрждрзНржмржкрзВрж░рзНржг ржкржжрзЗ ржмрж╕рж╛ ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖ржЧрзБрж▓рзЛрж░ ржЕржирзЗржХрзЗрж░ржЗ рж╕рзЗржЗ ржкржжрзЗрж░ ржЬржирзНржп ржирзНржпрзВржирждржо ржЯрзЗржХржирж┐ржХрзНржпрж╛рж▓ ржЬрзНржЮрж╛ржи ржирзЗржЗред ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ рждрж╛рж░рж╛ ржмрж╕рзЗ ржЖржЫрзЗ ржмржЫрж░рзЗрж░ ржкрж░ ржмржЫрж░, ржХрж╛рж░ржг рждрж╛ржжрзЗрж░ ржкрж░рж┐ржЪрзЯ ржЖржЫрзЗ, рж╕ржЦрзНржпрждрж╛ ржЖржЫрзЗ, ржмрж╛ рждрж╛рж░рж╛ ржХрзЗржмрж▓ ржЖржЧрзЗ ржерзЗржХрзЗржЗ ржмрж╕рзЗ ржЫрж┐рж▓ ржмрж▓рзЗ ржХрзЗржЙ ржЖрж░ ржкрзНрж░рж╢рзНржи рждрзЛрж▓рзЗ ржирж╛ред
рждрж╛рж░рж╛ ржЗржирж╕рж┐ржХрж┐ржЙрж░ржбред рждрж╛ржЗ ржкрзНрж░рждрж┐ржЯрж╛ рж▓рзЗржнрзЗрж▓рзЗ ржкрж▓рж┐ржЯрж┐ржХрзНрж╕ ржЪрж▓рзЗред ржЖржкржирж┐ ржЯрж┐ржо ржмржжрж▓рж╛рж▓рзЗржУ ржХрж┐ржЫрзБ рж╣ржмрзЗ ржирж╛ред ржЖржорж┐ ржХрж░рзЗржЫрж┐ред ржЕржнрж┐ржЬрзНржЮрждрж╛ ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржмрж▓ржЫрж┐тАФржХрж╛ржирж╛ржХрж╛ржирж┐, ржЪрзБрж▓рзЛржЪрзБрж▓рж┐ ржЖрж░ ржкрзЗржЫржирзЗ ржХржерж╛ ржмрж▓рж╛ ржпрзЗржи ржПржЗ ржкрзНрж░рждрж┐рж╖рзНржарж╛ржирзЗрж░ рж╕ржВрж╕рзНржХрзГрждрж┐ рж╣рзЯрзЗ ржжрж╛ржБрзЬрж┐рзЯрзЗржЫрзЗредржЖржкржирж┐ ржХрж╛рж░ржУ ржУржкрж░ ржнрж░рж╕рж╛ рж░рж╛ржЦрждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░ржмрзЗржи ржирж╛, ржХрж╛рж░ржг ржЖржкржирж┐ ржЬрж╛ржирзЗржи ржирж╛тАФ ржЖржкржирж╛рж░ ржШрж╛рзЬрзЗрж░ ржкрзЗржЫржирзЗ ржХрзЗ ржЫрзБрж░рж┐ ржорж╛рж░ржЫрзЗред
ржорзНржпрж╛ржирзЗржЬржорзЗржирзНржЯ? рждрж╛рж░рж╛ ржПрж╕ржм ржжрзЗржЦрзЗржУ ржжрзЗржЦрзЗржи ржирж╛редрждрж╛рж░рж╛ ржЪрж╛ржЗ ржирж╛ ржХрзЗржЙ ржХржерж╛ ржмрж▓рзБржХред рждрж╛рж░рж╛ рж╕ржорж╕рзНржпрж╛ржХрзЗ рж╕ржорж╕рзНржпрж╛ рж╣рж┐рж╕рзЗржмрзЗ ржжрзЗржЦрждрзЗ ржЪрж╛ржи ржирж╛тАФ рждрж╛рж░рж╛ ржЪрж╛ржи рж╕рзЗржЯрж╛ ржЪрзЗржкрзЗ ржпрж╛ржХ, ржпрзЗржи ржмрж╛ржЗрж░рзЗрж░ ржХрзЗржЙ ржирж╛ ржЬрж╛ржирзЗред ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржнрж┐рждрж░рзЗрж░ ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖ рждрзЛ ржЬрж╛ржирзЗ, ржмрзБржЭрзЗред
ржЖржкржирж┐ ржЧрзНрж▓рж╛рж╕ржбрзЛрж░рзЗ ржЧрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржЧржд рззрзж ржорж╛рж╕рзЗрж░ рж░рж┐ржнрж┐ржЙржЧрзБрж▓рзЛ ржжрзЗржЦрзБржитАФ рж╕ржм ржПржХ рж╕рзБрж░ред рждрж╛рж░ржкрж░ржУ ржпржжрж┐ ржХрзЗржЙ ржмрж▓рзЗ "рж╕ржмрж╛ржЗ ржЖржорж╛ржжрзЗрж░ ржкрзЗржЫржирзЗ рж▓рзЗржЧрзЗ ржЖржЫрзЗ", рждрж╛рж╣рж▓рзЗ рж╣рж╛рж╕рж┐ ржкрж╛рзЯред ржХрзЗ ржПржд рж╕ржорзЯ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржЖржкржирж╛рж░ ржкрзЗржЫржирзЗ рж▓рж╛ржЧржмрзЗ, ржмрж▓рзБржи? ржХрзЗржЙ ржХрж┐ рж╕рждрзНржпрж┐ржЗ ржПржд ржлрзНрж░рж┐?
ржПржЗ ржкрзНрж░рждрж┐рж╖рзНржарж╛ржирзЗ рж╢рзЗржЦрж╛рж░ ржХрж┐ржЫрзБ ржирзЗржЗ, рж╢рзЗржЦрж╛ржирзЛржУ рж╣рзЯ ржирж╛ред рж╢рзБржзрзБ рж╢рзЗржЦрж╛ржирзЛ рж╣рзЯ ржкрзЗржЫржирзЗ ржХржерж╛ ржмрж▓рж╛, ржХрзАржнрж╛ржмрзЗ ржХрж╛рж░ тАШрж▓рзЗржнрзЗрж▓тАЩ ржорзНржпрж╛ржирзЗржЬ ржХрж░рзЗ ржЯрж┐ржХрзЗ ржерж╛ржХрж╛ ржпрж╛рзЯ, ржХрж╛ржХрзЗ ржЦрзБрж╢рж┐ рж░рж╛ржЦрж▓рзЗ рж╕рзБржмрж┐ржзрж╛ ржорзЗрж▓рзЗред
ржПржЦржиржУ рж╕ржорзЯ ржЖржЫрзЗредржХрж░рзНржорзАржжрзЗрж░ рж╕ржорзНржорж╛ржи ржжрж┐ржи, ржкрж░рж┐ржмрзЗрж╢ржЯрж╛ рж╢рзБржжрзНржз ржХрж░рзБржиредржПржХржЯрж╛ ржХрж░рзНржорзА ржпржжрж┐ ржирж┐ржЬрзЗрж░ ржкрзНрж░рждрж┐рж╖рзНржарж╛ржирзЗрж░ ржУржкрж░ ржнрж░рж╕рж╛ рж░рж╛ржЦрждрзЗ ржирж╛ ржкрж╛рж░рзЗ, рждрж╛рж╣рж▓рзЗ ржЖржкржирж┐ рждрж╛рж░ ржХрж╛ржЫ ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржмрзЗрж╕рзНржЯ ржкрж╛рж░ржлрж░рзНржорзЗржирзНрж╕ ржЖрж╢рж╛ ржХрж░рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рзЗржи ржирж╛ред ржЖржкржирж┐ ржпржд ржмрзЬ рж╕рзНржпрж╛рж▓рж╛рж░рж┐ ржжрж┐ржи ржирж╛ ржХрзЗржи, ржПржХржЯрж╛ ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖ ржирж┐ржЬрзЗрж░ рж╕ржорзНржорж╛ржиржмрзЛржзрзЗрж░ рж╕ржЩрзНржЧрзЗ ржЖржкрж╕ ржХрж░рзЗ ржмрзЗрж╢рж┐ржжрж┐ржи ржЯрж┐ржХрзЗ ржерж╛ржХрждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рзЗ ржирж╛ред

title: unutilized potential, poor culture
content:
I worked as a back end engineer in multiple project. Thank god i left this hell. I have mixed experience . The managers are hard loyal to the korean owners , is not a good thing for the employees always. Some times no good requirement document is maintained. No good process is followed. Pm team is a joke. Pressure come from the top. It is frustrating. Internal team culture is also poor. Group of uncultured and low class front-end engineer always blame the back-end team. They are more interested in playing game of dirty politics and blame others.
There was not to many chance to learn new thing. Some team mate were good, well mannered. but few bad apples are rotting the entire culture. Shame to the managers, they did not prevent this.┬аGood benefits compared to other companies. but the company did not utilize it's potential
still if you want to explore, its not bad place for u....

title: ржмрж╛ржЯржкрж╛рж░ ржЖрж░ ржЫрзЛржЯрж▓рзЛржХ ржкрзНрж░рждрж┐рж╖рзНржарж╛ржиред
content:
ржпрж╛рж░рж╛ ржЖржлрждрж╛ржмржиржЧрж░ ржПрж░рж┐рзЯрж╛ рждрзЗ ржерж╛ржХрзЗржи ржнрзБрж▓рзЗржУ ржирж┐ржЬрзЗрж░ рж╕ржирзНрждрж╛ржиржжрзЗрж░ ржПржЗ ржмрж╛ржЯржкрж╛рж░ ржкрзНрж░рждрж┐рж╖рзНржарж╛ржирзЗ ржкрж╛ржарж╛ржмрзЗржи ржирж╛ред
ржЯрж┐ржЪрж╛рж░ржжрзЗрж░ ржХрж╛ржЧржЬрзЗ рзи ржШржирзНржЯрж╛/ржжрж┐ржи рж▓рзЗржЦрж╛ ржЙрж▓рзНрж▓рзЗржЦ ржерж╛ржХрж▓рзЗржУ ржПрж░рж╛ ржЯрж┐ржЪрж╛рж░ржжрзЗрж░ рзй ржПржоржиржХрж┐ рзк ржШржирзНржЯрж╛ ржкрж░рзНржпржирзНржд ржмрж╕рж┐рзЯрзЗ рж░рж╛ржЦрзЗред ржХрзЛржи рж╢рж┐ржХрзНрж╖рж╛ ржкрзНрж░рждрж┐рж╖рзНржарж╛ржи ржмрж╛ ржХрзЛржЪрж┐ржВ рж╕рзЗржирзНржЯрж╛рж░рзЗрж░ ржорзНржпрж╛ржирзЗржЬржорзЗржирзНржЯ ржПржд ржлрж╛рж▓рждрзБ рж╣рзЯ ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржЬрж╛ржирж╛ ржЫрж┐рж▓ржирж╛ред
-ржЕржжржХрзНрж╖ ржорзНржпрж╛ржирзЗржЬрж╛рж░ред рж╕рзНржЯрзБржбрзЗржирзНржЯржжрзЗрж░ ржоржзрзНржпрзЗ рж╢рзГржЩрзНржЦрж▓рж╛ ржЖржирждрзЗ ржмрзНржпрж░рзНрже ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржлрж╛ржХрж╛ ржмрзБрж▓рж┐ ржжрзЗржУрзЯрж╛рждрзЗ ржПржХрзНрж╕ржкрж╛рж░рзНржЯ
-ржорж╛рж╕рзЗ рззрзи ржжрж┐ржирзЗрж░ ржЪрзБржХрзНрждрж┐ ржерж╛ржХрж▓рзЗржУ,┬а рззрзп ржжрж┐ржи ржХрж╛ржЬ ржХрж░рзЗржУ ржПржХрзНрж╕ржЯрзНрж░рж╛ рж╕рзНржпрж╛рж▓рж╛рж░рж┐ ржжрзЗржУрзЯрж╛рж░ ржХржерж╛ ржмрж▓рзЗржУ ржжрзЗрзЯржирж┐
-Owner ржПрж░ ржЫрзЗрж▓рзЗ ржорзЗрзЯрзЗржжрзЗрж░ ржЖрж▓рж╛ржжрж╛ ржкрзНрж░рж╛рзЯрзЛрж░рж┐ржЯрж┐ ржкрзНрж░ржжрж╛ржиред ржирж░ржорж╛рж▓ рж╕рзНржЯрзБржбрзЗржирзНржЯржжрзЗрж░ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ рждрж╛ржжрзЗрж░ ржЪрж┐ржирзНрждрж╛ ржирж╛ржЗ, ржЧрзБржЯрж┐ ржХрзЯрзЗржХ owner ржПрж░ ржЫрзЗрж▓рзЗ ржорзЗрзЯрзЗ ржХрзЗ рж╕ржм ржлрзНржпрж╛рж╕рж┐рж▓рж┐ржЯрж┐ ржжрзЗрзЯред ржЕржержЪ рж╕ржмрж╛ржЗ ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ рж╕ржорж╛ржи ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗржЗ ржкрзЬрзЗред
-рж╢рж┐ржХрзНрж╖рж╛рж░ ржХрзЛржи ржкрж░рж┐ржмрзЗрж╢ ржирж╛ржЗ, рж╣ржпрж░рж▓ ржЕржмрж╕рзНржерж╛ред ржЯрж┐ржЪрж╛рж░ржжрзЗрж░ рж╕рж╛ржерзЗ ржХрж┐рж░ржХржо ржмрж┐рж╣рзЗржн ржХрж░рждрзЗ рж╣рзЯ рж╕рзЗржЯрж╛ ржорзНржпрж╛ржирзЗржЬрж╛рж░ ржЬрж╛ржирзЗржирж╛
-рж╕ржмрж╛ржЗ ржХрзЗ ржмрж▓рзЗ ржмрзЗрзЬрж╛рзЯ ржПрж░рж╛ ржирж╛ржХрж┐ ржкрж╛ржмрж▓рж┐ржХ ржнрж╛рж░рзНрж╕рж┐ржЯрж┐рж░ ржмрж╛ ржЯржк ржкрзНрж░рж╛ржЗржнрзЗржЯ ржнрж╛рж░рзНрж╕рж┐ржЯрж┐рж░ ржЫрж╛рждрзНрж░ржжрзЗрж░ ржЯрж┐ржЪрж╛рж░ рж╣рж┐рж╕рж╛ржмрзЗ рж░рж╛ржЦрзЗ, ржЕржержЪ рзи-рзз ржЬржи ржмрж╛ржжрзЗ ржмрж╛ржХрж┐ рж╕ржм ржЯрж┐ржЪрж╛рж░рзЗрж░ ржХрзЛрзЯрж╛рж▓рж┐ржЯрж┐ ржкрзБрж░рж╛ржЗ рж╢рж┐ржЯ рж▓рзЗржнрж▓рзЗрж░ред
-ржПржХржЬржи ржорзНржпрж╛ржирзЗржЬрж╛рж░ ржпрж╛рж░ ржжрж╛рзЯрж┐рждрзНржм ржкрзНрж░рж╢рзНржи рждрзИрж░рж┐ ржХрж░рж╛, рж╕рзЗржЯрж╛ржУ ржкрж╛рж░рзЗржирж╛ ржарж┐ржХржорждред ржЖржкржирж┐ ржирж┐ржЬ ржерзЗржХрзЗ рж╕рж╛рж╣рж╛ржпрзНржп ржХрж░рзЗржЫрж┐ ржмрзЗрж╢ ржХрзЯрзЗржХржмрж╛рж░ред ржпрзЗржЯрж╛ ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржжрж╛рзЯрж┐рждрзНржм ржирж╛

title: Interning or Scamming?
content:
If you are a fresh graduate and thinking to plan for your internship at Narayanganj City Corporation?
Then HELL NO!
WASTED 8 MONTHS OF LIFE IN THIS SHITTY PLACE AND GOT 0 KNOWLEDGE? AND MONEY? Lol!
The Cheif and Superintendenting Engineers are complete bullshit.┬а (Asgar & Aziz). Asgar pretends he knows every single thing about structure and design. And will bash you infront of everyone just to show off his expertise. I completed my B.sc still he appointed me with a diploma engineer. The gap was huge. I couldnтАЩt even merge with him as I directly did my bachelor's after HSC. The diploma engineer was expecting that I would be knowing the technical stuffs as like him. About the environment?┬а Chief's peon will behave like a full time engineer here xD. I was there for 8 months. DidnтАЩt even get a table & chair to sit. The corruption?┬а Whenever they had to do those dealings, he used to say, ржпрж╛ржУ ржмрж╛ржЗрж░рзЗ ржЧрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржмрж╕рзЛред
Guys! Never ever come at this shitty place if you love your life & career.

title: Vibe engineer to Kamla Pro
content:
Pros:
Salary is paid on time at the end of each month.
Paid Leave (PL) is granted after 5 years of service. ЁЯеХ
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology.
Cons:
Extremely high-pressure work environment, often under unreasonable individuals. ЁЯдб
Many senior employees have left due to declining company policies. Only a few in management remain lap ЁЯРХ, and blind obedience is expected. You'll receive plenty of ЁЯеХ but with strings attached.
Rampant internal politics.
Product team lacks focus, engages in internal politics, and often blames developers for their own shortcomings.
The CTO behaves more like a product manager, rarely supports developers, and encourages sycophancy ЁЯЫвЁЯЫв. Career growth is largely based on flattery.
The company has shifted from being tech-driven to being led by operations and CEO mandates.
Salary structure is inconsistent. Some individuals with close ties to management receive double the salary for average performance. Interns often remain at the lowest pay grade indefinitely.
HR practices are arbitrary. HR personnel get rapid promotions (e.g., 5 times in 4 years), while others face a promotion freeze. HRтАЩs main role is to please management, not support employees. They enforce bizarre rules and rarely resolve real issues.
If youтАЩre from SUST or RUET, you may be fast-tracked. Others must go through 4тАУ5 interview rounds with ЁЯдб.

title: ржлрж╛ржБржХрж╛ ржХрж▓рж╕рж┐ ржмрж╛ржЬрзЗ ржмрзЗрж╢рж┐ред ржжрзЗржУрж▓рж┐рзЯрж╛ ржХрзЛржорзНржкрж╛ржирж┐ред
content:
ржЦрзБржмржЗ short ржХрж░рзЗ ржмрж▓ржмрзЛ рзйржЬржи ржорж┐рж▓рзЗ ржЕржлрж┐рж╕ ржЪрж╛рж▓рж╛ржЗред HR ржПржХржЯрж╛ ржЖржЫрзЗ ржлрж╛ржБржХрж╛ ржХрж▓рж╕рж┐ ржмрж╛ржЬрзЗ ржмрзЗрж╢рж┐ ржПржоржиред ржЙржирж┐ рзйржЬржирзЗрж░ ржПржХржЬржиред ржЖржорж╛рж░ рзйржорж╛рж╕рзЗрж░ salary ржжрзЗржЗ ржирж╛ред ржЖржмрж╛рж░ ржЕржлрж┐рж╕рзЗ ржЬрзЗрждрзЗ рзиржжрж┐ржи ржпржжрж┐ рзлржорж┐ржирж┐ржЯ рж▓рзЗржЯ рж╣рзЯ рззржжрж┐ржирзЗрж░ salary ржХрзЗржЯрзЗ ржирзЗржмрзЗржиред
ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржжрзЗрж░рж┐ ржХрж░рзЗ ржЫрзБржЯрж┐рж░ ржмрзЗрж▓рж╛рж░ ржХрзЛржирзЛ extra ржХрж┐ржЫрзБ ржжрзЗржмрзЗ ржирж╛ред рждрж╛ржжрзЗрж░ ржоржи ржорж╛ржирж╕рж┐ржХрждрж╛ ржПржд ржирж┐ржЪрзБ ржмрж▓рж╛рж░ ржмрж╛рж╣рж┐рж░рзЗред ржПржжрзЗрж░ ржХрзЛржорзНржкрж╛ржирж┐ ржжрж┐рждрзЗ ржХрзЗ ржмрж▓рзЗржЫрж┐рж▓рзЛ ржХрзЗ ржЬрж╛ржирзЗред
ржпржЦржи рждрж╛рж░рж╛ salary ржжрж┐рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░ржмрзЗ ржирж╛ ржЖржкржирж╛ржХрзЗ ржмрж▓ржмрзЗ ржЖржЬржХрзЗ ржжрж┐ржЪрзНржЫрж┐ ржХрж╛рж▓ржХрзЗ ржжрж┐ржЪрзНржЫрж┐ ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржХрзНрж▓рж┐рзЯрж╛рж░ ржХрж░рзЗ ржХрж┐ржЫрзБржЗ ржмрж▓ржмрзЗ ржирж╛ ржХржмрзЗ ржжрзЗржмрзЗред ржпржЦржи ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛рж░ ржЬржирзНржп ржЕржлрж┐рж╕рзЗ ржЬрзЗрждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░ржмрзЗржи ржирж╛ рждржЦржи ржмрж▓рзЗ ржХрзЗржирзЛ ржЕржлрж┐рж╕рзЗ ржЖрж╕рзЗ ржирж┐ред ржорж╛ржирзЗ ржПржЦрж╛ржирзЗ ржЪрж╛ржХрж░рж┐ ржХрж░рж▓рзЗ ржирж┐ржЬрзЗрж░ ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ ржЦрж░ржЪ ржХрж░рзЗ company рждрзЗ invest ржХрж░ржмрзЗржиред
admin ржПржХржЯрж┐ ржЖржмрж╛рж▓ ржЖржЫрзЗ ржХрж┐ржЫрзБржЗ ржмрзБржЭрзЗ ржирж╛ development ржПрж░ ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржЙрж▓ржЯрж╛ ржкрж╛рж▓ржЯрж╛ ржХржерж╛ ржмрж▓рж╛рж░ ржмрзЗрж▓рж╛ржЗ ржУрж╕рзНрждрж╛ржжред

title: ржнржгрзНржбрждрзНржмрзЗ ржбрж┐ржкрзНрж▓рзЛржорж╛: ржЧрзЛ*ржо ржорзБ** ржЕрзНржпрж╛ржирзНржб ржжрзНржп ржкрж┐ржХржирж┐ржХ ржкрж▓рж╛ржкрж╛ржЗржи ржЧрзНржпрж╛ржВ
content:
ржЧрзЛ*ржо ржорзБ** ржПржХржЬржи ржЖржкрж╛ржжржорж╕рзНрждржХ ржнржгрзНржб тАУ рждрж╛рж░ ржорзЗржХрж┐ рж╣рж╛рж╕рж┐ ржЖрж░ ржЕржжрзНржнрзБржд рж╕рж┐ржжрзНржзрж╛ржирзНрждрзЗ ржЕржлрж┐рж╕ ржпрзЗржи ржЯрзНрж░рзНржпрж╛ржЬрж┐ржХ ржХржорзЗржбрж┐рж░ рж╕рж┐ржирзЗржорж╛ред
ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржПржХрж╛ ржиржи рждрж┐ржирж┐ тАУ рж╕рж╛ржерзЗ рж░ржпрж╝рзЗржЫрзЗржи CEO рж░рж╛ржлрж┐ ржжрзМрж▓рж╛ ржПржмржВ CTO ржЖржорж┐ржирзБрж▓ рж╣рзЛрж╕рж╛ржЗржи тАУ ржПржЗ рждрзНрж░ржпрж╝рзА ржорж┐рж▓рзЗ ржЧрзЬрзЗ рждрзБрж▓рзЗржЫрзЗржи ржПржХ тАЬржнрзБржпрж╝рж╛ ржорзНржпрж╛ржирзЗржЬржорзЗржирзНржЯ ржкрзНрж░рж╛ржЗржнрзЗржЯ рж▓рж┐ржорж┐ржЯрзЗржбтАЭред
ЁЯСЙ ржХрж░рзНржорзАржжрзЗрж░ ржкрж┐ржХржирж┐ржХрзЗрж░ ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛?
рж╣рж╛рж╕рзНржпржХрж░!
ржУржЯрж╛ ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржПржирж╛рж░рж╛ ржирж┐ржЬрзЗрж░рж╛ ржлрзБрж░рзНрждрж┐ ржХрж░рзЗржи, рж░рзЗрж╕рзНржЯрзБрж░рзЗржирзНржЯрзЗ ржЧрж▓рж╛ ржЕржмржзрж┐ ржЦрзЗрзЯрзЗ ржПрж╕рзЗ ржмрж▓рзЗржи тАУ "ржмрж╛ржЬрзЗржЯ ржХржо ржЫрж┐рж▓!"
ЁЯСЙ ржЕржлрж┐рж╕рзЗрж░ ржкрж░рж┐ржмрзЗрж╢?
ржнрж╛ржЩрж╛ржЪрзЛрж░рж╛ ржжрзЗржпрж╝рж╛рж▓рзЗ ржШрзЗрж░рж╛ ржПржХржЯрж╛ ржЭрзБржкрзЬрж┐рж░ ржорждрзЛ ржЬрж╛рзЯржЧрж╛рзЯ тАУ ржпрзЗржи ржЖржорж░рж╛ ржбрзЗржнрзЗрж▓ржкрж╛рж░ ржирж╛, ржмржиржмрж╛рж╕рзА ржХрж░рзНржоржЪрж╛рж░рзАред
ЁЯСЙ ржПржХржмрж╛рж░ ржкрж┐ржХржирж┐ржХ рж╣рж▓рзЛ ржирж╛, ржПржоржкрзНрж▓рзЯрж┐рж░рж╛ ржирж┐ржЬрзЗрж░рж╛ ржХрж╛ржЫрж╛ржХрж╛ржЫрж┐ ржПржХржЯрж╛ ржЯрзНржпрзБрж░ рж╕рж╛ржЬрж╛рж▓рзЛред
рждрж╛ ржорзБрж░рзНрж╢рзЗржж рж╕рж╛рж╣рзЗржм ржмрж▓рж▓рзЗржи, тАЬржирж╛! ржпрж╛ржмрзЗ ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржкржЫржирзНржж ржХрж░рж╛ рж╕рзЗржЗ ржкржЪрж╛ ржмрзБржлрзЗрждрзЗ тАФ ржпрзЗржЦрж╛ржирзЗ ржлрзНрж░рж╛ржЗржб рж░рж╛ржЗрж╕рзЗрж░ ржоржзрзНржпрзЗ ржХрж░рзБржгрж╛рж░ ржорждрзЛ ржЪрж┐ржХрзЗржирзЗрж░ ржЯрзБржХрж░рзЛ ржкрзЬрзЗ ржерж╛ржХрзЗредтАЭ ржЬрзЛрж░ ржХрж░рзЗржЗ рж╕ржмрж╛ржЗржХрзЗ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржЧрзЗрж▓рзЗржи рж╕рзЗржЗ ржмрж┐рж░ржХрзНрждрж┐ржХрж░ ржмрж╛ржЯржЦрж╛рж░рж╛ржмрзЛржЭрж╛ ржЬрж╛рзЯржЧрж╛рзЯред
ЁЯСЙ рж╕ржорж╛рж▓рзЛржЪржирж╛? ржЧржаржиржорзВрж▓ржХ?
рждрж╛рж░ рж╕рж╛ржоржирзЗ? ржнрзБрж▓рзЗ ржпрж╛ржУ!
ржХрж╛рж░ржг ржЙржирж╛рж░ ego ржПржХржЯрж╛ ржкрж░рзНржмрждрзЗрж░ рж╕ржорж╛ржи, рж╕рж╛ржорж╛ржирзНржп ржоржирзНрждржмрзНржпрзЗржЗ ржЙржирж╛рж░ ржнрзЗрждрж░рзЗрж░ ржорж╛ржЗржХрзНрж░рзЛ-ржбрж┐ржХрзНржЯрзЗржЯрж░ ржЬрзЗржЧрзЗ ржУржарзЗред
ЁЯСЙ ржПрждрзЗржУ рж╢рж╛ржирзНрждрж┐ ржирзЗржЗред
ржХрзЗржмрж▓ ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ ржорзЗрж░рзЗ ржирзЯ, ржПржмрж╛рж░ ржХрж░рзНржорзАржжрзЗрж░ ржкржХрзЗржЯ ржерзЗржХрзЗржУ ржУржирж╛рж░рж╛ ржЪрж╛ржБржжрж╛ рждрзЛрж▓рзЗржи тАФ ржХрзЛржирзЛ ржжрж┐ржи ржоржирзЗ рж╣рзЯ рж░рж╛рж╕рзНрждрж╛рзЯ ржжрж╛ржБрзЬрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржерж╛рж▓рж╛ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржмрж▓ржмрзЗ,
> тАЬржнрж╛ржЗ ржПржХржЯрзБ ржжрж╛ржУ ржирж╛, рж╕рж┐ржЗржУтАЩрж░ рж╢ржкрж┐ржВ ржмрж╛ржХрж┐ ржЖржЫрзЗредтАЭ
---
рж╕ржВржХрзНрж╖рзЗржкрзЗ ржмрж▓рж▓рзЗ:

title: Western bootlicker who doesn't approve Govt. holidays
content:
TKCL тАФ where policies are flexible enough to bend logic, not in your favor. WeтАЩve innovated a leave structure that skips government holidays entirely and offers a generous 30-day blend of "Casual + Sick" leave тАФ because apparently, rest and illness are interchangeable.
Our HR department? Culinary connoisseurs. They clock in daily, not to solve HR issues, but to critique the salt content in your lunch like Gordon Ramsay on a budget. Meanwhile, our in-house catering consistently delivers traumatic food poisoning experiences тАФ a true team-building exercise in gastrointestinal survival.
Forget your resume тАФ your real KPI here is your spin serve in table tennis. Promotions arenтАЩt based on performance reviews but on how well you smash that ping pong ball. Degrees? Certifications? Irrelevant. Can you dominate the TT table? YouтАЩre CEO material.
Thinking of joining the DevOps team? A quick heads-up: the software department is so male-dominated, the server room might as well be a man cave. Inclusivity pending system update.
Leadership here is composed of late-20s and early-30s individuals with the emotional maturity of expired yogurt. Their idea of тАЬcorporate cultureтАЭ is recycling decade-old memes from WhatsApp groups that shouldтАЩve stayed deleted.
Salary is creditedeventually, like a plot twist in a bad soap opera. Increment? Think of it as a rounding error.

title: Lots of scope to learn
content: After building e-commerce and HR/ERP systems, I joined Gotipath and started learning new things about how OTT platforms work and scalable system design from Sohel Bhai and their COO, Sifat Bhai. I was only there for two months due to some personal reasons. But the team is very friendly.

title: SSL : ржмрж╛ржЗрж░рзЗ ржлрж┐ржЯржлрж╛ржЯ, ржнрж┐рждрж░рзЗ рж╕ржжрж░ржШрж╛ржЯ
content:
SSL wireless / SSLCommerz ржХрзЗ рж╕ржмрж╛ржЗ ржПржХ ржирж╛ржорзЗ ржЪрж┐ржирзЗред ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржПржЗ ржХрзЛржорзНржкрж╛ржирзАрждрзЗ ржХрж┐ржЫрзБ ржЯрзНржпрж╛рж▓рзЗржирзНржЯрзЗржб рж▓рзЛржХржЬржи ржерж╛ржХрж╛ рж╕рждрзНрждрзЗржУ рж╢рзБржзрзБржорж╛рждрзНрж░ ржЯржк-ржорзНржпрж╛ржирзЗржЬржорзЗржирзНржЯ ржПрж░ ржмрзНржпрж░рзНржерждрж╛рзЯ ржЖржЬржХрзЗ ржПржЗ ржмрж╛ржЬрзЗ ржЕржмрж╕рзНржерж╛ред ржХрж┐ржЫрзБ ржХрж┐ржЫрзБ ржЯрж┐ржо рж▓рж┐ржб, ржбрж┐ржкрж╛рж░рзНржЯржорзЗржирзНржЯ-рж╣рзЗржб ржерзЗржХрзЗ рж╢рзБрж░рзБ ржХрж░рзЗ ржЯржк-ржорзНржпрж╛ржирзЗржЬржорзЗржирзНржЯрзЗрж░ рж▓рзЛржХржЬржи ржПржоржбрж┐ ржПрж░ ржкрж╛ ржЪрж╛ржЯрж╛рзЯ ржмрзНржпрж╕рзНржд ржерж╛ржХрзЗред ржЖрж░ ржЙржирж╛рж░ ржЖржЬржЧрзБржмрж┐ ржпржд ржЦрж╛рзЯрзЗрж╢ ржкрзБрж░ржи ржХрж░рзЗред ржПржЖржЗ (AI) ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржХрж┐ ржпрзЗржи рж╣рж╛ржд-ржШрзЛрзЬрж╛ ржмрж╛ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржлрзЗрж▓ржмрзЗ, ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржХрж┐ ржмрж╛ржирж╛ржмрзЗ, ржХрж┐ржнрж╛ржмрзЗ ржмрж╛ржирж╛ржмрзЗ, ржХрзЗржи ржмрж╛ржирж╛ржмрзЗ рж╕рзЗржЯрж╛ ржЬрж╛ржирзЗ ржирж╛ред ржПржХ ржорж╛рж╕рзЗрж░ ржбрзЗржнрзЗрж▓ржкржорзЗржирзНржЯ ржХрж╛ржЬ рждрж┐ржи ржжрж┐ржирзЗ рж╢рзЗрж╖ ржХрж░рж╛рж░ ржХржорж┐ржЯржорзЗржирзНржЯ ржХрж░рзЗ ржЖрж╕рзЗред ржПрж░ржкрж░ рж╕рж╛рж░рж╛ рж░рж╛ржд-ржжрж┐ржи ржПржХ ржХрж░рзЗ ржбрзЗржнрзЗрж▓ржкрж╛рж░ржжрзЗрж░ ржЦрж╛ржЯрж╛ржУред
ржПржЗ ржЕржлрж┐рж╕рзЗрж░ ржПржоржкрзНрж▓рзЯрж┐ ржлрзНржпрж╛рж╕рж┐рж▓рж┐ржЯрж┐ ржмрж▓рждрзЗ ржХрж┐ржЫрзБ ржирж╛ржЗред ржирж┐ржЬрзЗрж░ ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛рзЯ ржЯрзНржпрзБрж░рзЗ ржпрж╛ржУ, ржкрж┐ржХржирж┐ржХрзЗ ржпрж╛ржУ, ржЗржлрждрж╛рж░ ржХрж░, ржЬрзНржпрж╛ржХрзЗржЯ ржХрж┐ржиред рзо-рззрзж ржЬржирзЗрж░ ржЬржирзНржп ржорж╛рж╕рзЗ рзз ржкрзНржпрж╛ржХрзЗржЯ ржЯрж┐рж╕рзНржпрзБ ржжрзЗрзЯ, рждрж╛ржУ рж╕ржм ржорж╛рж╕рзЗ ржжрзЗрзЯ ржирж╛ред ржмрж╛ржерж░рзБржорзЗрж░ ржЕржмрж╕рзНржерж╛ ржкрж╛ржмрж▓рж┐ржХ ржЯрзЯрж▓рзЗржЯрзЗрж░ ржоржд тАУ рж▓рж╛ржЗржи ржзрж░рж╛ рж▓рж╛ржЧрзЗред рж╕рж┐ржЯрж┐ржВ ржЖрж░рзЗржЮрзНржЬржорзЗржирзНржЯ ржПржирзНржб ржХрж╛ржЬрзЗрж░ ржПржиржнрж╛ржЗрж░ржиржорзЗржирзНржЯржжрзЗржЦрж▓рзЗ ржоржирзЗ рж╣рзЯ рж╕ржжрж░ржШрж╛ржЯрзЗ ржЪрж▓рзЗ ржЖрж╕рж▓рж╛ржоред
рж▓рж╛ржЮрзНржЪ тАУржирж╛рж╢рждрж╛рж░ рждрзЛ ржмрж╛рж▓рж╛ржЗ ржирж╛ржЗред ржорж╛ржЙрж╕рзЗрж░ ржмрзНржпрж╛ржЯрж╛рж░рзА, рж╣рзЗржбржлрзЛржи ржирж┐ржЬрзЗрж░ ржХрж┐ржирзЗ ржХрж╛ржЬ ржЪрж╛рж▓рж╛рждрзЗ рж╣рзЯред ржЦрж╛рждрж╛ тАУ ржХрж▓ржоржУ ржжрзЗрзЯ ржирж╛ред PF, Gratuity тАУ ржПрж░ ржкрзНрж░рж╢рзНржиржЗ ржЖрж╕рзЗ ржирж╛ред ржжрзЗрж╢рзЗрж░ ржЖрж░ ржХрзЛржи ржЕржлрж┐рж╕рзЗрж░ ржПржЗржЪржЖрж░ (HR) ржПрж░ржХржо ржЕржерж░рзНржм ржХрж┐ржирж╛ ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржЬрж╛ржирж╛ ржирж╛ржЗред
ржЯржк-ржорзНржпрж╛ржирзЗржЬржорзЗржирзНржЯрзЗрж░ ржПрж╕ржм ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржорж╛ржерж╛ ржмрзНржпржерж╛ ржирж╛ржЗред рждрж╛рж░рж╛ ржирж┐ржЬрзЗржжрзЗрж░ ржЪрж╛ржХрж░рзА ржмрж╛ржБржЪрж╛рждрзЗ ржмрзНржпрж╕рзНрждред ржПржХржЯрж╛ ржкрзНрж░рзЛржбрж╛ржХрзНржЯ рж╕ржорзЯ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржХрж┐ржнрж╛ржмрзЗ ржЧрзЬрзЗ рждрзБрж▓рждрзЗ рж╣рзЯ ржмрж╛ рж░рзЗржнрж┐ржирж┐ржЙ ржЬрзЗржирж╛рж░рзЗржЯ ржХрж░рждрзЗ рж╣рзЯ рждрж╛ ржирж╛ ржХрж░рзЗ рж╢рзБржзрзБ ржПржЖржЗ- ржПржЖржЗ- ржПржЖржЗ ржХрж░рждрзЗ ржерж╛ржХрзЗ ржЖрж░ ржжрж┐ржи ржжрж┐ржи ржХрж░рзНржорзА ржЫрж╛ржЯрж╛ржЗ ржХрж░рждрзЗржЫрзЗред ржЖржкржирж╛рж░рж╛ ржжрзЯрж╛ ржХрж░рзЗ ржЖрзЯржирж╛рж░ рж╕рж╛ржоржирзЗ ржжрж╛ржБрзЬрж╛ржиред ржирж┐ржЬрзЗрж░ ржорзЗрж░рзБржжржирзНржб ржарж┐ржХ ржЬрж╛рзЯржЧрж╛рзЯ ржЖржЫрзЗ ржирж╛ржХрж┐ ржмрж┐ржХрзНрж░рж┐ ржХрж░рзЗ ржжрж┐ржЫрзЗржи ржЪрзЗржХ ржХрж░рзЗржиред ржЖржкржирж╛ржжрзЗрж░ ржЖржирзНржбрж╛рж░рзЗ ржпрж╛рж░рж╛ ржХрж╛ржЬ ржХрж░рждрзЗржЫрзЗ рждрж╛рж░рж╛ржЗ ржХрзЛржорзНржкрж╛ржирзАрж░ ржкрзНрж░рж╛ржгред рждрж╛ржжрзЗрж░ ржорзВрж▓рзНржпрж╛рзЯржи ржХрж░рзЗржи, рждрж╛ржжрзЗрж░ рж╕рзБржмрж┐ржзрж╛-ржЕрж╕рзБржмрж┐ржзрж╛ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржХржерж╛ ржмрж▓рзЗржиред ржирзЯржд рж╕рж╛ржоржирзЗ ржзрж╕ ржарзЗржХрж╛рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░ржмрзЗржи ржирж╛ред

title: Could Have been the the Best in BD, Ended up being Average because of poor Decisions
content:
Strong Focus on Kubernetes and Cloud-Native TechnologiesAppscode operates deeply within the Kubernetes and cloud-native ecosystem, providing engineers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge and highly sought-after technologies. For developers passionate about infrastructure, automation, and distributed systems, this is a major advantage.
Open Core Projects with Community ImpactThe company maintains open core projects that are tightly integrated with the Kubernetes ecosystem. This allows engineers to contribute to widely adopted tools, build a strong public portfolio, and gain recognition within the open-source community.
Dedicated Time for Research and Development (R&D)Engineers are encouraged to spend time on R&D, often engaging with complex technical challenges such as scalability, distributed systems, and automation. This fosters deep technical growth and intellectual stimulation.
Accelerated Learning and Growth OpportunitiesDue to the nature of the work and the technology stack, team members gain significant hands-on experience and exposure in a relatively short period. There's good number of stable and prominent clients like Nokia, Microsoft, GreenHouse etc.
Collaborative, Developer-Friendly EnvironmentThe office culture, largely shaped and maintained by the employees themselves, is supportive and collaborative. The company has a strong engineering-focused culture, with many team members coming from competitive programming backgrounds. This shared technical mindset fosters mutual understanding and helps new hires adapt quickly.
Competitive Local CompensationSalaries are well-aligned with the local market, and payments are reliably made on time.
Risk of BurnoutThe high-paced nature of the work and the constant learning curve can lead to burnout if not properly managed by both individuals and leadership.
Limited Project RotationEngineers often remain on the same project for extended periods. While this can deepen expertise, it can also lead to stagnation or frustration, especially when moving on to a very similar project afterward.
Understaffed Office ManagementThe HR and administrative departments are relatively small and under-resourced, which can lead to miscommunication or poorly handled internal matters.
Limited Recreation and Wellness FacilitiesThere are currently insufficient provisions for physical activities, team-building events, or relaxation spaces. As the company scales, this gap is becoming more apparent and increasingly necessary to address.
Inconsistent Performance Review ProcessUnderperformance is not always addressed in a timely or constructive manner. Some employees receive inadequate feedback or support, which can lead to abrupt terminations or demoralization.
Top-Down Leadership ApproachLeadership often prioritizes their own strategic vision over team feedback. This can create a disconnect between management and employees and reduce the sense of inclusivity and ownership within the team.
Lack of Mutual Commitment in EmploymentNew hires are frequently expected to commit for the long term, but the organization does not always reciprocate this commitment. The dismissal of experienced team members has contributed to a higher-than-average turnover rate and organizational instability.
Demotivating Work CultureInconsistent managerial support and the absence of a strong, cohesive office culture can lead to disengagement and reduced morale across the team.
Short Career Progression TrajectoryThere is limited visibility into long-term career paths within the company. Most engineers tend to leave within 2тАУ3 years, often due to a lack of professional growth opportunities.
Actively collect and review employee feedbackтАФboth current and formerтАФto identify areas for organizational improvement.
Reassess company policies around work-life balance, employee well-being, leave structure, and office environment to better align with company growth and employee needs.
Invest in clear career development frameworks and employee retention strategies to support long-term growth and reduce attrition.
Foster a more inclusive and transparent leadership culture where feedback from all levels is considered and valued.

title: Kamla khana
content:
Those who work here have no personal life. Since employees are working from home, management assumes they are available 24/7. The workload is massive, and if you work lifelessly without boundaries, youтАЩll be considered a good employee.
They also have very odd festive bonus rules: 18% in the 1st year, 35% in the 2nd year, and 45% from the 3rd year onward.
Overall, itтАЩs a toxic culture with unrealistic expectations and poor work-life balance.

title: Bully culture, Nepotism and Poor management
content:
They hire top level employees but the management is too poor. Unrealistic deadlines, employees had to work day and night, weekend. Don't bother about professionalism.
Yearly increment is shady. The relatives of the owner threat and bully the employees. Toxic environment due to this Nepotism as owner only listen to this.

title: Best software company in Bangladesh in terms of Work Life balanace.
content:
First of all there is no HR.
90+ employees solely run by themselves, Working on 100% European clients.
Work life balance is honestly the best in BD. If you want work Remote or hybrid work that is solely upto you and your team mates, no mamangement is involved here. Same goes for leave policy, it is decided by you and your teammates.
They provide very good Lunch and the real "unlimited snacks".
Also all the indoor activities and Team building events outside BD is 100% organised and managed by employees almost zero management involved.
This is the best part tbh.

title: BJIT Academy is a scam
content:
While starting their 4-month long unpaid training period, they'll tell you about 50% of trainees are assured of permanent job. When you finish it, you'll realize what a scam it has always been. Their evaluation is not fair at all. They will favor anyone they wish, not based on merit or expertise. In short, you'll lose 4 valuable months from your life. Moreover, they don't provide any certificate although they say they'll provide.
What's more ridiculous is, they have a history of offering permanent job verbally & revert it on the same/next day.
I'm glad that I left it even before attending for two months due to their toxic rules.

title: Software engineer kamla
content:
With all the buzz the city bank creates with trendy corpo talks, the city bank IT division is a shit show where they will tell you they have great expectations from you and if you are able to deliver them the rewards are endless. But this just a "mula" they hang in front of you and you are nothing but kamla to them. But this kamla not only have to deliver but have to deliver them with dress code and if by any chance you take a day or two sick leave all your deliveries will become worthless.
So if you want to become stressed kamla on the verge of collapse, please join the wonderful world of City Bank IT division.
I wish someone told me this before i joined this shithole and burned my peace of mind. The corporate politics are rampant, this no place for engineers to be in. This placed forced me to forget all my engineering practices and just deliver anything at any cost.

title: Bad leadership and toxic work culture
content:
This company has two CTOs, but their technical skills are very poor. Most of the good employees have already left. The CTOs are still here, probably because they donтАЩt have the skills to get a similar job in a top company.
One of the CTOs, Kayum, is known for micromanaging and playing office politics. He even threatens to ruin employeesтАЩ careers if he doesnтАЩt like them. He forces team leaders to stay late and work extra hours.
He also has no clear vision. Right now, he is working on a card management system, but no one really understands what he is building or what the goal is. It feels like even he doesnтАЩt know what heтАЩs doing.
In my opinion, this is the worst leadership IтАЩve seen in any big company in Bangladesh.

title: Micro manage
content:
If I could change "micro manage" from the dictionary and replace it with another word it would be Brac IT.
The managers would hourly ask about the current state of task. As a fresher, I would go to them for suggestions and such, but they would show that they are to busy, but funnily they are busy playing table tennis. After several months, I realized, it's not that they don't want to help, they don't know what to do, and I AM NOT JOKING.
The thing is, these so called senior engineers and managers have been in Brac IT for God knows how long, and some projects have become highly dependent on them for domain knowledge. But their coding related knowledge is at the level of a 2-3 YOE dev. They would just pass the requirement to the dev and say something like make me this, make me that, and use these tools and resources. They don't even know what these does, they just have a high level overview of the system. They are only there to continuesly terrorize others and take hourly notes on what you do. And also say, I quote "apnake ichcha korlei fire kore dawar capability ase amar, 8tar aage bashay jaben mane ki? 10tay eshe ki kore felsen? Kaaj sesh kore jaben". The so called kaaj would take minimum of 3 days to complete, bu these tech illiterate people give such estimations in grooming. They expect that a new employee would take 2 days to get the required domain knowledge, and BAMM, I NEED THIS FEATURE NEXT WEEK.
I am damn sure that these seniors won't even pass the 3yoe interview for other companies in Bangladesh, both in terms of tech knowledge and how to handle a team and handle employees that a team lead would have the responsibility of.
These team leads receive hefty 12-20% increment each year, and others receive 4-5%.
A fresher would join with 20-25k and after 3 years might get 45k, if they oil these leads efficiently. But they hire more employees with 3YOE with 60k+. But they leave after 5-6 months.
They are now trying to hire freshers internally cause it seems that freshers don't know a thing, and they are so desperate, you can make them do anything, tell them to work for 12 hours, tell them to work in weekends without payment(that is also a thing here, and this is regular, not due to release or sudden prod issues, cause I quote again "WORK LIFE BALANCE WORD TA BANAISE JARA KAAJE FAKI DEY TAARA"). Some one who has worked in other places would know in a beat that this is the true definition of hell.
Lastly, I thought that the exploitation was not known to the upper level employees such as CTO. But laters found out that the CTO was in on it also.
The salary discrepancy here is huge. If you are a long time senior with no tech knowledge, you get 120k+, else highest you would get 70k. People hired with 100k from other companies leave this hell within 4-5 months will less salary to another. Every other companies I know of now maintains a relative scale about the salary.

title: More of a Family Office
content:
Office is full of CEO's relatives. All of his brothers are director here. Earlier it used to be CEO and one of his younger brother. When the company began to grow they decided to bring one of their brother who was working on a bank and made him director. With such experience he was assigned to HR role and also to financial activities. I doubt he has enough knowledge about HR policy and stuffs. Each decision of his including cost cutting lowered employee satisfaction
You will officialy get 10 casual leaves per year. But you won't be able to redeem all of them. They will invade your privacy and you have to explain in details why you want this leave. This doesnтАЩt guarantee your leave either. You have to go here and there for permission. They will give a disappointing look whenever you go to them for leave.
They don't even keep promises. Once┬а they announced to start provident fund but they didn't. Another time they said they did a great profit and declared in front of everyone that next year they will give profit bonus but they didn't. Such false promises prevails

title: Topu, Himel & Anika тАУ The Bosses of BRAC IT Hiring
content: At BRAC IT, if you knowTopu,Himel, orAnika, you donтАЩt need an interview. Just say тАЬHiтАЭ and youтАЩre in! Especially if youтАЩre fromSELIES, welcome to the VIP club!┬аBut for others? We have to give3 or 4 interviews, wait for calls, and still get nothing. Is that fair?It feels like friends are hiring friends, not the right people for the job. This is not how a big company like BRAC should work.Dear BRAC IT boss and board, please look into this. People are noticing. ItтАЩs not a good look.

title: Your Beautiful But Toxic Girlfriend
content:
The Company looks amazing..
But just like your toxic girlfriend, it has toxicity.
Like you can't take office device outside Dhaka so you have to get back in Dhaka very soon after Eid just like Garments workers even if you have home office facility. Pathetic for software engineers to return to Dhaka after 3days of Eid just to work for a foreign client who's not in Dhaka!
Office time not flexible. Work pressure is increased to make you work overtime. Daily Burn-out due to pressure is called productivity here.
But again just like your beautiful toxic girlfriend, you'll love here.

ЁЯдг ржжрж┐ржмрж╛рж╕ржкрзНржи... ржХрзЛржи ржХрж╛рж░ржг ржжрзЗржЦрж┐рзЯрзЗ рзлрзжрзж ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ ржХрзЗржЯрзЗ, рзирзжрзж ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ ржмрзЛржирж╛рж╕ ЁЯШВред ржПржЦржи ржмрж▓рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рзЗржи, рзирзжрзж ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ ржПржЗржЯрж╛ ржоржирзЗ рж╣рзЯ ржмрж▓рж╛рж░ ржЬржирзНржпрзЗ ржмрж▓ржЫрж┐ред ржирж╛ ржнрж╛ржЗ, рж╕рж░рзНржмржЪрзНржЪрзЛ ржмрзЛржирж╛рж╕ ржЗ рзйрзлрзж ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ рж╣рзЯржирж┐ред ржХрзЗржЙ ржХрзЗржЙ рззрзжрзж something ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ ржкрзЗрзЯрзЗржЫрзЗред ржирж╛ржЙ, ржПржЗ рззрзжрзж ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржИржж ржХрж╛ржЯрж╛ржУред ржЕржирзЗржХрзЗ рждрзЛ ржкрж╛рзЯ ржУ ржирж┐ред ржПржЦржи ржмрж▓рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рзЗржи, ржПрждрзЛ Employee ржХрж┐ ржХрж┐ржЫрзБ ржХрж░рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░ржЫрзЗ ржирж╛? title: ржмрзЗрждржи ржХржо
content:
ржПржХржЯрж┐ ржХрзЛржорзНржкрж╛ржирж┐ ржпрзЗржЦрж╛ржирзЗ ржЧрж╛рж░рзНржорзЗржирзНржЯрж╕ ржХрж░рзНржорзАржжрзЗрж░ ржЪрзЗржпрж╝рзЗржУ ржХржо ржмрзЗрждржирзЗ (рззрзж-рззрзи рж╣рж╛ржЬрж╛рж░ ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛) ржжржХрзНрж╖ ржХрж░рзНржорзА ржирж┐ржпрж╝рзЛржЧ ржХрж░рж╛ рж╣ржпрж╝ред ржЗржирзНржЯрж╛рж░ржнрж┐ржЙрждрзЗ ржмрж▓рж╛ рж╣ржпрж╝, "ржЖржкржирж┐ ржпрзЗрж╣рзЗрждрзБ ржПржЦржиржУ ржмрж┐рж╢рзЗрж╖ржЬрзНржЮ ржиржи, ржЗржирзНржЯрж╛рж░рзНржи рж╣рж┐рж╕рзЗржмрзЗ ржпрзЛржЧ ржжрж┐ржиред" ржПрж░ржкрж░ рззрзж-рззрзи рж╣рж╛ржЬрж╛рж░ ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ ржмрзЗрждржи ржжрзЗржУржпрж╝рж╛ рж╣ржпрж╝, ржпржжрж┐ржУ ржХрж╛ржЬрзЗрж░ ржЪрж╛ржк ржЕржирзЗржХ ржмрзЗрж╢рж┐ред
ржкрзНрж░ржмрзЗрж╢ржи ржкрж┐рж░рж┐ржпрж╝ржбрзЗрж░ ржирж┐рж╖рзНржарзБрж░ ржмрж╛рж╕рзНрждржмрждрж╛
ржкрзНрж░ржмрзЗрж╢ржи ржкрж┐рж░рж┐ржпрж╝ржб рзй ржорж╛рж╕, ржпрзЗржЦрж╛ржирзЗ ржХрж░рзНржорзАржжрзЗрж░ ржХрж╛ржЫ ржерзЗржХрзЗ рж╕рзЗрж░рж╛ ржкрж╛рж░ржлрж░ржорзНржпрж╛ржирзНрж╕ ржЖрж╢рж╛ ржХрж░рж╛ рж╣ржпрж╝ред ржпржжрж┐ржУ ржкрж╛рж░ржлрж░ржорзНржпрж╛ржирзНрж╕ ржнрж╛рж▓рзЛ рж╣рж▓рзЗржУ ржмрзЗрждржи ржмрж╛ржбрж╝рзЗ ржирж╛ред рж╢рзБржзрзБржорж╛рждрзНрж░ ржпрж╛рж░рж╛ рж▓рж┐ржбрж╛рж░ржжрзЗрж░ 'ржУржпрж╝рзЗрж▓рж┐ржВ' ржмрж╛ ржЦрзБрж╢рж┐ ржХрж░рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рзЗ, рждрж╛ржжрзЗрж░ ржмрзЗрждржи рж╕рж╛ржорж╛ржирзНржп ржмрж╛ржбрж╝рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рзЗред

title: There is no future for the company or its employees.
content: The boss of this company is extremely delusional. He favors people who are good at flattery rather than those with real skills. There is no clear visionтАФemployees are simply expected to implement his unrealistic ideas. Internal politics are rampant. In every department, the team leads are often ineffective but maintain their positions by flattering upper management. One of the worst situations is in the tech team, which is heavily politicized. The tech team lead there is extremely toxicтАФhe actively suppresses the growth of other team members and is deeply involved in office politics.

title: Balanced Company
content:
This is a good company for those people who want to learn new things and work with dynamic project.
This is a fully remote position and it gives opportunity to stay with your family. This is blessing for me. Also gives all the government government holidays. Maximum time you don't need to work after office hour.┬а During project deadline sometime need to work after office hour. During weekend,┬а no one knock you. Even it is prohibited to reply the message of JP team during weekend.
The environment here is friendly. All the team members are┬а cooperative.
The regional director is a amazing person. Sometimes he give us some technical direction that really solve some critical problem.┬а He is a great leader. He knows well how to handle situation.

title: "A Heartfelt Tribute to an Inspiring Leader
content: Jakir Hasan, the CEO of WPXPO, is truly an exceptional and inspiring individual. His humility and warm personality are genuinely admirable. ItтАЩs always a pleasure to connect with someone so kind-hearted and sincere. Wishing him continued success and fulfillment in all his endeavors.

title: Ona-Astha IT
BRAC IT? More like BRAC Bye IT
content:
If youтАЩre planning to work here, just remember to keep your resignation letter AND a backup job readyтАж not thatyouтАЩllresign тАФ theyтАЩll probably fire you before lunch. No joke, itтАЩs like a reality show in there "WhoтАЩs getting fired today?" Tune in at 10AM sharp!

You could be doing your work perfectly, helping the team, even bringing snacks тАФ doesnтАЩt matter. One day youтАЩre at your desk, next day youтАЩre updating your LinkedIn bio like, тАЬOpen to work ЁЯШЕ.
It's honestly a mystery how anyone survives there for more than a week. Maybe they hand out invisibility cloaks to the chosen ones?
So yeah, if you love surprises, enjoy chaos, and hate job security тАФ BRAC IT is your dream destination. Otherwise... run.

ржЖрж╣рж╛! ржХрзА ржорж╛ржиржмрж┐ржХрждрж╛! ржПрж░ ржоржзрзНржпрзЗ ржбрзЗржнрзЗрж▓ржкрж╛рж░рзЗрж░ ржорж╛ржирж╕рж┐ржХ ржЕржмрж╕рзНржерж╛рж░ ржХрзА рж╣рж╛рж▓ рж╣рзЯрзЗржЫрж┐рж▓, рж╕рзЗржЯрж╛ ржмрзБржЭрждрзЗ ржЙржирж╛рж░ рж╕ржорзЯ ржмрж╛ ржмрзБржжрзНржзрж┐ ржХрзЛржирзЛржЯрж╛ржЗ ржЫрж┐рж▓ ржирж╛ред
ржПржЗ ржнржжрзНрж░рж▓рзЛржХрзЗрж░ ржХрж╛ржЬ ржЖрж╕рж▓рзЗ ржХрзА? ржЕржлрж┐рж╕рзЗ ржПрж╕рзЗ ржмрзНржпрж╛ржХржПржирзНржб рж▓рж┐ржб ржкрзНрж▓рж╛ржмржи ржШрзЛрж╖ ржЖрж░ рждрж╛рж░ рж░рж╛ржЬрж╕ржнрж╛рж░ ржкрзНрж░рждрж┐ ржЕржирзБржЧржд ржерж╛ржХрж╛ тАФ ржжрзАржкрж┐рждрж╛ рж╕рж╛рж╣рж╛ ржкрзВржЬрж╛ (ржлрзНрж░ржирзНржЯржПржирзНржб рж▓рж┐ржб ржирж╛ржоржзрж╛рж░рзА), ржЬрж╛рж╣рж┐ржж рж╣рж╛рж╕рж╛ржи (ржкрзНрж▓рж╛ржмржирзЗрж░ ржЫрж╛рзЯрж╛ ржмрж╛ ржЕржирзБржЧржд ржнрзГрждрзНржп), ржЖрж░ рж╕рзБрж╕рзНржорж┐рждрж╛ рж╕рж╛рж╣рж╛ тАФ ржпрж╛рж░рж╛ ржЕржлрж┐рж╕ рж╕ржорзЯржХрзЗ тАЬржШрзБржо ржУ рж╢ржкрж┐ржВтАЭ рж╕рзЗрж╢ржирзЗрж░ ржЬржирзНржп ржмрж░рж╛ржжрзНржж рж░рзЗржЦрзЗржЫрзЗржиред ржПржжрзЗрж░ ржХрж╛ржЫрзЗ ржбрзЗрж▓рж┐ржнрж╛рж░рж┐ ржорж╛ржирзЗржЗ "ржжрзБржкрзБрж░ рзйржЯрж╛рж░ ржкрж░ dependency ржмрж╛ржирж╛ржУ ржЖрж░ ржмрж╛ржХрж┐ржжрзЗрж░ ржШрж╛рзЬрзЗ ржлрзЗрж▓рзЗ ржжрж╛ржУ" тАФ ржПржмржВ ржорзБрж░рзНрж╢рзЗржж рж╕рж╛рж╣рзЗржм рж╕рзЗржЗ ржоржЮрзНржЪрзЗрж░ ржжрж░рзНрж╢ржХ ржиржи, ржмрж░ржВ ржкрж░рж┐ржЪрж╛рж▓ржХред
ржжрж▓рзЗрж░ ржХрзЗржЙ ржирж╛ржХрзЗрж░ ржЬрж▓ ржЪрзЛржЦрзЗрж░ ржЬрж▓ ржлрзЗрж▓ржЫрзЗ ржкрзНрж░рзЗрж╢рж╛рж░рзЗ тАФ ржЖрж░ ржорзБрж░рзНрж╢рзЗржж рж╕рж╛рж╣рзЗржм? рждрж┐ржирж┐ ржпрзЗржи тАЬрж╕ржм ржарж┐ржХ ржЖржЫрзЗтАЭ рж╕рж╛ржЗржиржмрзЛрж░рзНржб ржЭрзБрж▓рж┐рзЯрзЗ рж╣рзЗржбржлрзЛржи ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржмрж╕рзЗ ржЖржЫрзЗржиред ржЕржжрзГрж╢рзНржп рж╣рж▓рзЗржУ рждрж╛рж░ presence project ржзрзНржмржВрж╕рзЗ ржпржерзЗрж╖рзНржЯред
ржПржЯрж╛ ржпржжрж┐ ржХрзЛржирзЛ Netflix рж╕рж┐рж░рж┐ржЬ рж╣рждрзЛ, рждрж╛рж╣рж▓рзЗ ржПрж░ ржирж╛ржо рж╣рждрзЛ тАФ тАЬThe Chronicles of Corporate ClownsтАЭ, featuring Golam Murshed as the lead villain.

title: рж╕рзЛржирж╛рж▓рзА ржЕрждрзАржд, ржзрзЛржБрзЯрж╛рж╢рж╛ржЪрзНржЫржирзНржи ржмрж░рзНрждржорж╛ржи
content:
ржЧрж▓рзНржк ржмрж▓ржЫрж┐ ржЙржЗржбрзЗржнрж╕рзЗрж░ред
ржПржХржЯрж╛ рж╕ржорзЯ ржЫрж┐рж▓рзЛтАФрж╕рзЛржирж╛рж▓рзА рж╕ржорзЯред рж╕ржмрж╛ржЗ ржЖржирзНрждрж░рж┐ржХрждрж╛ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржХрж╛ржЬ ржХрж░рждрзЛ, ржорзБржЦрзЗ рж╣рж╛рж╕рж┐, ржоржирзЗ рждрзГржкрзНрждрж┐ред ржХрзЛржорзНржкрж╛ржирж┐рж░ рж░рзЗржнрж┐ржирж┐ржЙ ржЫрж┐рж▓рзЛ ржЖржХрж╛рж╢ржЫрзЛржБрзЯрж╛, ржоржирзЗ рж╣рждрзЛ ржнржмрж┐рж╖рзНржпрзО ржЖрж░ржУ ржЙржЬрзНржЬрзНржмрж▓ред
рждржмрзЗ ржЕржмрж╛ржХ рж▓рзЗржЧрзЗржЫрзЗ ржпржЦржи ржжрзЗржЦрж▓рж╛ржо, ржХрзЛржорзНржкрж╛ржирж┐ рж╣ржарж╛рзО ржХрж░рзЗржЗ ржХрж┐ржЫрзБ ржЕржжрзНржнрзБржд ржкржжржмрзА ржЖрж░ ржмрж┐рж╢рж╛рж▓ ржЕржЩрзНржХрзЗрж░ ржкрж╛рж░рж┐рж╢рзНрж░ржорж┐ржХ ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржХрж┐ржЫрзБ рж▓рзЛржХржХрзЗ тАШржкрзЛрж╖рж╛тАЩ рж╢рзБрж░рзБ ржХрж░рж▓рзЛред рж╕рзЗржЗ ржЬрж╛рзЯржЧрж╛ ржерзЗржХрзЗржЗ ржкрзНрж░ржержоржмрж╛рж░рзЗрж░ ржорждрзЛ ржлрж╛ржЙржирзНржбрж╛рж░ржжрзЗрж░ рж╕рж┐ржжрзНржзрж╛ржирзНржд ржирзЗржУрзЯрж╛рж░ ржпрзЛржЧрзНржпрждрж╛ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ рж╕ржирзНржжрзЗрж╣ ржЬрж╛ржЧрзЗред ржЖрж░ рж╕рзЗржЗ рж╕ржирзНржжрзЗрж╣ ржПржЦржирзЛ ржХрж╛ржЯрзЗржирж┐ред
ржПржХрж╕ржорзЯ ржЕржлрзБрж░ржирзНржд рж╕ржорзНржнрж╛ржмржирж╛рзЯ ржПржЧрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржЪрж▓рж╛ ржПржЗ ржХрзЛржорзНржкрж╛ржирж┐рж░ ржЧрзНрж░рзЛрже ржпрзЗржи ржХрзНрж░ржорзЗржЗ ржержоржХрзЗ ржпрж╛ржЪрзНржЫрзЗред
ржЯржк ржорзНржпрж╛ржирзЗржЬржорзЗржирзНржЯ ржЖржЬржУ ржбрж╛ржЙржиржлрж▓рзЗрж░ ржХрж╛рж░ржг ржЦрзБржБржЬрзЗ ржмрзЗрзЬрж╛ржЪрзНржЫрзЗтАФржпрзЗржи ржЪрзЛржЦрзЗрж░ рж╕рж╛ржоржирзЗржЗ рж╕ржмржХрж┐ржЫрзБ ржЖржЫрзЗ, рждржмрзБржУ ржмрзБржЭрждрзЗ ржЪрж╛рзЯ ржирж╛ред ржПржЯрж╛ ржпрзЗржи ржЪрзЛржЦрзЗрж░ рж╕рж╛ржоржирзЗ ржерж╛ржХрж╛ ржирж┐ржЬрзЗрж░ ржирж╛ржХржЯрж╛ ржЗржЪрзНржЫрзЗ ржХрж░рзЗржЗ ржЕржЧрзНрж░рж╛рж╣рзНржп ржХрж░рж╛рж░ ржорждрзЛред
рждржмрзЗ ржПржЯрж╛ ржмрж▓рждрзЗржЗ рж╣рзЯтАФржЙржЗржбрзЗржнрж╕ ржЙржжрж╛рж░ ржПржХ ржкрзНрж░рждрж┐рж╖рзНржарж╛ржиред рж╕рзБржпрзЛржЧ-рж╕рзБржмрж┐ржзрж╛ ржжрж┐рждрзЗ ржХржЦржирзЛ ржХрзГржкржгрждрж╛ ржХрж░рзЗ ржирж╛ред рждрж╛ржЗ ржПржХржЯрж╛ рж╕рзБржкрзНржд ржнрж╛рж▓рзЛржмрж╛рж╕рж╛ ржПржЦржирзЛ рж░рзЯрзЗ ржЧрзЗржЫрзЗ ржХрзЛржорзНржкрж╛ржирж┐ржЯрж╛рж░ ржкрзНрж░рждрж┐ред
ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржЖржлрж╕рзЛрж╕ рж╣рзЯ, ржпржжрж┐ ржлрж╛ржЙржирзНржбрж╛рж░рж░рж╛ ржжрзЗрж╢рзЗ ржерж╛ржХрждрзЗржи, ржирж┐ржЬрзЗрж░ ржЪрзЛржЦрзЗ рж╕ржмржХрж┐ржЫрзБ ржжрзЗржЦрждрзЗржи, рждрж╛рж╣рж▓рзЗ ржорж┐ржб-ржорзНржпрж╛ржирзЗржЬржорзЗржирзНржЯ ржирж╛ржоржХ рж╕рзЗржЗ тАШржХрзНржпрж╛ржирзНрж╕рж╛рж░тАЩ ржерзЗржХрзЗ рж╣рзЯрждрзЛ ржорзБржХрзНрждрж┐ ржкрж╛ржУрзЯрж╛ ржпрзЗрждред
ржпрж╛рж░рж╛ ржУрзЯрж╛рж░рзНржбржкрзНрж░рзЗрж╕ ржЗржирзНржбрж╛рж╕рзНржЯрзНрж░рж┐рждрзЗ ржЖржЫрзЗржи, рждрж╛рж░рж╛ ржирж┐рж░рзНржжрзНржмрж┐ржзрж╛рзЯ ржПржЦрж╛ржирзЗ ржЬрзЯрзЗржи ржХрж░рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рзЗржиред ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржпрж╛рж░рж╛ SaaS ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ рж╕рж┐рж░рж┐рзЯрж╛рж╕рж▓рж┐ ржнрж╛ржмржЫрзЗржи, рждрж╛ржжрзЗрж░ ржЬржирзНржп рж╣рзЯрждрзЛ ржПржЯрж╛ рж╕ржарж┐ржХ ржЬрж╛рзЯржЧрж╛ ржирзЯред
Note: Layoffs are regular nowadays.

title: Best Software Company with Best Work Culture
content:
At Strativ, leadership is recognized and rewarded based on genuine merit тАФ real technical skills and true leadership qualities, not politics or flattery.
ItтАЩs a place where you can truly breathe. The people тАФ from HR, management to colleagues to support staff тАФ are respectful, supportive, and always radiate positivity.
The food? Absolutely endless. From cold drinks, ice cream, fruits, snacks, and coffee to high-quality breakfast and lunch тАФ itтАЩs all there.
Extra effort doesnтАЩt go unnoticed тАФ they pay extra for extra hours.
Need time off? Leave policies are smooth and stress-free.
The salary range is among the best in the industry тАФ possibly the highest.
Special occasions are genuinely celebrated, often with delicious meals and thoughtful gifts.
Once your daily work is done, youтАЩre free to go тАФ no unnecessary clock-watching.
Family comes first here. In any emergency, your well-being is the priority, and work-life balance is sincerely respected.
YouтАЩll be surrounded by the most helpful and encouraging team members тАФ from HR to the support staff and always ready to serve you with very positively.
Skill development is actively supported, and youтАЩll have plenty of chances to share and learn through regular тАЬLearn & GrowтАЭ sessions.
Feeling tired or bored? The game room and recreation area always have someone around for a chat or a quick game. ItтАЩs a great space to unwind.
Need a break? YouтАЩll find bean bags everywhere тАФ perfect for
a rest or a quick nap.

title: This AinтАЩt the Place for That Talk
content:
LetтАЩs get one thing straightтАФyour office meeting is not the place to be throwing around words like тАЬfuckup.тАЭ
Yeah, we all get frustrated. Deadlines slip, shit happens, someone drops the ball. But dragging that kind of language into a formal meeting? ThatтАЩs not boldтАФthatтАЩs just bad judgment.
YouтАЩre not impressing anyone. YouтАЩre not being тАЬreal.тАЭ YouтАЩre just making the room uncomfortable and killing any shot at productive conversation.
Want to lead? Learn to vent with respect. Learn to call out problems without blowing up the room. Professionalism isnтАЩt about being fakeтАФitтАЩs about knowing when to check your tone.

title: тЪая╕П Honest Review of TechnoNext Software Limited тАУ Proceed with Caution
content:
Pros:
тЬЕ Relaxed work environment, often feels like a government job
тЬЕ Timely salary payments
тЬЕ Minimal workload in many teams
Cons:
тЭМ No clear salary structure тАФ same roles, random pay differences
тЭМ Skilled and dedicated employees are neither promoted nor valued
тЭМ Severe mismanagement тАФ top leadership lacks basic tech and people skills
тЭМ Rampant nepotism тАФ many managers are related, creating biased teams
тЭМ Toxic team culture тАФ politics and flattery matter more than performance
тЭМ Unprofessional HR тАФ always тАЬlooking into it,тАЭ never resolving issues
тЭМ No standard development process тАФ no scope for creativity or best practices
тЭМ Increments/promotions are inconsistent and drama-filled
тЭМ Employees have been fired without proper reason or process
тЭМ Fake Glassdoor reviews monthly to maintain false public image
Bottom Line:TechnoNext is not a place for ambitious, skilled professionals. However, it can be a haven for people at the end of their careers тАФ especially if they know how to negotiate well and impress unskilled management with empty talk. Growth, merit, and real talent are sadly overlooked.

title: American Mula
content: This company is a disgusting, unethical dump. They treat workers like garbage, demanding instant expertise with zero support. Grace in England acts like a cruel slave owner, while the Bangladeshi director ignores the employees' suffering. HR is a nightmareтАФtwo hours late on day one, no weekends, and an India-based team threatens to blacklist you in Bangladesh. Pay raises are delayed, and they hire and fire for no reason. A toxic fraud that should be banned. DonтАЩt join unless you want to be used and fired in months.

title: Best place to work if you're a NEET with zero talent
content:
Pros
Unlimited caffeine and food.
Sports room and a Play room with a PS5, perfect for decompressing after a hard day of eating, shitting, and editing JSON files.
Colleagues are (mostly) friendly.
Engineering? Optional. Most of the work involves tweaking JSONs until something тАЬjust works.тАЭ If youтАЩre terrified of never making it in tech, getting in here is like securing permanent employment for life.
ThereтАЩs this curious pattern where ex-employees leave, suddenly turn into brilliant engineers, and start makingseriousmoney elsewhere. Orbitax doesnтАЩt exactly nurture talent; it just injects enough frustration to push people to go above and beyond, level up, and escape this charming little utopia.
Multiple annual trips, both localandinternational (only poor SEA countries). This serves as an effective distraction from the creeping realization that you're slowly settling into a life of overwork and quiet mediocrity.
Cons
Depending on your team lead, you may need to do some lightglazing(details redacted).
The codebase was designed by someone read Uncle Bob once and couldn't find a better outlet to unleash his newfound passion for over-engineering. Want to add a simple button? Sorry, youтАЩll need to navigate the CoreтДв library, a radioactive wasteland of Lovecraftian horror. (Pro Tip:Aim to position yourself in the golden mean within the company. Not bad enough to get blamed for everything, but not good enough to be trusted with touching this monstrosity of an abstraction layer).
Weekend work does happen occasionally (but they let you sleep it off later with a compensatory day off).

title: ржЦрж╛ржЬржирж╛рж░ ржЪрзЗржпрж╝рзЗ ржмрж╛ржЬржирж╛ ржмрзЗрж╢рж┐ (Fraud Alert!)
content:
Avoid this company at any cost if you don't want to destroy your career and living.
Don't be fooled by their appealing attire, office space and social coverage. Only people who worked with them know the reality.

title: Mental Gymnastics, Gaslighting & Surveillance тАУ Welcome to the Jungle
content:
The company was founded by a couple who studied in India, worked there for a blink, then came back and decided to build a software "company" in BangladeshтАФexcept they seem to have imported theworst parts of Indian tech culturewhile skipping anything remotely progressive.
Here, engineers are treated like factory workers with keyboards. Creativity? Respect? Career growth? Forget it. You're expected to nod, obey, and become emotionally numb.
The place runs on fear, manipulation, and a bizarre obsession with control. TheyтАЩll withhold your certificates, praise you one day and humiliate you the nextтАФall carefully designed to keep you unstable and grateful just to exist. Classic psychological warfare, dressed as "discipline."
Top management? Basically a family reunion + high school friend group. If you're hoping for growth based on talent, better hope youтАЩre also cool with doing their dirty work and becoming part of the bullying chain.
They're also elite-level liarsтАФfluent in gaslighting. The rules? Ever-changing. Transparency? Non-existent. Tracking employee social media is standard, and theyactuallycount your bathroom breaks. If they could legally install cameras in the toilets, they probably would.
Most people still working there are suffering from full-blownStockholm Syndrome. It messes with your head, your confidence, and your ability to trust other workplaces again. I'm still recovering.
TL;DR:If you like freedom, growth, or mental peaceтАФrun. If you're into psychological abuse dressed up as a job, congratulationsтАФyou've found your people.

title: The only bad thing about Cefalo: you donтАЩt want to leave Cefalo.
content:
Cefalo chooses leads based on their actual leadership and technical qualities тАФ not by oiling managers.
You can breathe here. The colleagues, the management, even our support staff тАФ all are well-behaved, well-managed, and bring a full positive vibe.
Bottomless food тАФ and they mean it! Cold drinks, ice cream, fruits, snacks, coffee, quality breakfast and lunch. If you stay after 8 PM for any reason, theyтАЩll even provide dinner.
They pay extra if you need to work extra.
No issues when it comes to taking leave.
The salary range is one of the highest тАФ if not the highest.
Special days like MotherтАЩs Day, FatherтАЩs Day, or Boishakh are celebrated with special meals and sometimes gifts.
You can leave when your daily tasks are done.
No one will stop you if thereтАЩs an emergency тАФ youтАЩre always allowed to prioritize your family. The work-life balance is top-notch.
YouтАЩll find the most supportive colleagues here.
TheyтАЩll fund your skill development.
YouтАЩll get opportunities to share your learnings and ideas.
ThereтАЩs always someone in the game room or on the rooftop to talk to and share your thoughts тАФ a great way to beat boredom and loneliness.

title: Best Company to Learn and Grow
content: Ollyo (previously known as JoomShaper too), is one of the finest companies in Bangladesh. I have worked for few years in the company. Their culture, learning and growth environment, quality of research and development is truly fantastic. I would not believe if anyone say negative about it, because I worked for a quality time there, and joined there with no reference from anyone from that company. They hired me from public openings. I am so glad that I worked in this company and got opportunity to work with some fantastic young people. I got a great CTO at my time, Nirjhor Anjum, a true Tech Guru and legend. He established agile scrum with PM processes fantastically in the organization, and we learned JIRA well at his time. I got a fantastic CEO, Kawshar Ahmed. There was another great UX Guru, Risat Rajin who made the designs live at his time. Especially, Kawshar Ahmed is such a talent who truly knows what he is making, and I admire him for that. I am glad that I learned a lot from the company that helped me to join my next company in a great role where I am working now. I wish all the best for the team.

title: The Best Experience of My Career So Far
content:
My experience as a Senior Software Engineer at my current company, Friends Corps, has been the best compared to all my previous workplaces. IтАЩm truly satisfied with my role here.
When it comes to management, I have to highlight Mohammad Monir Hossain, the Country Director of Bangladesh. He is the best boss IтАЩve ever had тАФ not just a leader, but one of the greatest mentors in my life.

title: A good startup software company
content: This is good for fresher. And there ceo is super friendly with employees.

title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer
content:
Pros:
1. Secured job
2. Satisfying working environment
3. Salary disbursed on time.
Cons:
1. Very slow promotion criteria
2. Nepotism
3. Some general managers owned his division as the division is his fathers property.

title: Working for more than three years, all good
content:
It's a very nice place to work, speically the team I work for. Good Salary, food , perks, collegues.
One of the nicest thing about craftsmen is it's CEO Azad bhai. Very humble person. Professioanl approach towards everything.
when the mass layoff was happening worldwide, He came into our room and said if craftsmen ever need to layoff , he'll let us know 2-3 months earlier. The layoff never happened. However, It's this approach what makes him and his company truly unique.
At every increment, he sits with you to discuss the increment. Jodio amake expected ta dei nai xD, but this opportunity┬а is very nice. Most companies would just throw an email.
Of course , it might have it's flaws, but i haven't noticed any yet.

title: Thriving in Balance: My Journey to a Healthier Work Culture at FC (FRIENDS CORP.)
content:
In my 6 years of career lifespan, IтАЩve got the chance to work in 4 different, small to big, companies and have experienced different work cultures. After working here in FC (FRIENDS CORP.) as a Senior Software Engineer Position for the last 2 years I see how different it is and I couldn't imagine working in such a fantastic workтАУlife balance culture, where I could spend more time with my family, and friends and on my hobbies while working remotely from home here in Bangladesh.
What truly sets FC (FRIENDS┬аCORP.) apart is the incredible leadership behind it. IтАЩm deeply grateful to our management team for not only creating a supportive and flexible environment, but also for genuinely caring about the well-being and growth of every employee. Their thoughtful approach and consistent encouragement make it possible for us to thrive both professionally and personally. I feel proud and fortunate to be part of such a forward-thinking and compassionate organization.

title: DSi is a good place to work
content:
DSi is a classic software company in Bangladesh with a flexible work environment. You can grow fast if you push yourself, or work comfortably at your own pace. The company has great learning resources and expert engineers, and knowledge sharing is a big part of the culture.
The top three leaders are highly skilled software engineers, making the whole environment very developer-friendly. Recently, DSi introduced an engineering manager layer, so the management side is growing and improving. While there were some management gaps before, theyтАЩre being addressed now.
Other facilities are being added, though snacks, lunch are a bit expensive. Salaries are always on time. Like any company, DSi has had ups and downs, but the last five years showed strong growth, and now itтАЩs in a stable phaseтАФsoon expected to grow again, InshaAllah.
ItтАЩs a fresher-friendly approach and gives newcomers flexibility early on. Overall, DSi is a good place to work in the Bangladeshi tech scene

title: My One-Month Nightmare at Freelance Hub BD. Overwork, Broken Promises, and Unpaid Wages
content:
I joined a company named Freelance Hub BD. Their job description boasted the 'best company culture,' which prompted me to apply. I was called for an interview along with several other candidates and was subsequently selected. When they asked for my preferences, I explained that my previous role was remote, and this one was on-site. I requested the flexibility to work remotely during my exam periods, as I wouldn't be able to come to the office then, but I assured them I would work from home on those days. They agreed, stating it wouldn't be a problem. Their official off-days were Friday and Saturday, and their office hours were from 11:30 AM to 9:00 PM.
For the first two days after joining, my workload was manageable. However, after that, it became incredibly difficult. I only stayed for one month due to their behavior. The reasons for my departure after such a short time began in my first week. Although Friday and Saturday were their designated off-days, they asked me to come into the office on Friday. I declined because I had plans to visit my village for personal reasons. I left for my village on Thursday night after work. I returned on Saturday night, and I remember being stuck in traffic after my bus arrived in Dhaka around 9:00 PM. They called me, asking about my whereabouts, saying there was urgent work that needed to be done. I told them I was on the bus. They then instructed me to work after reaching home and said they would send the documents via WhatsApp. Due to the heavy night traffic in Dhaka, I didn't reach home until nearly 11:00 PM. After a brief five-minute rest, they called again, pressuring me to do the work. That was my only weekend off тАУ I never had another Friday and Saturday off after that. They consistently forced me to work on Fridays and Saturdays and even insisted I come to the office on Fridays.
During regular office days, I would go to the office and work until 10:00 PM or 11:00 PM, then return home. Even after that, they would call me to work remotely throughout the night. When I said I couldn't, they would plead with me, saying, 'Vaiya, please adjust a little.' I would work the entire night, get a little sleep, and then they would call me to go to the office, even if I had only gotten home around 2:00 AM after the previous day's work. After working all day and night, if I tried to sleep, they would knock on my door, and if I didn't respond, they would call me repeatedly. One day, I refused to work. My new colleague, who was facing a similar situation, told me that on the day I refused to work, the company told him they were looking for another developer and asked if he knew anyone. This all happened within just one month.
In that one month, I canтАЩt remember a single night where I slept properly тАФ some nights I only got one or two hours of sleep. Just because of this, I left the company after only one month. That one month at the office was just horrible.
I left the job in March, but even today, they havenтАЩt paid me. I have called the MD, but he always makes excuses, and to this day, they havenтАЩt paid me. I canтАЩt even fully explain how horrible the experience was. Not only have they not paid me, but they also havenтАЩt paid other former employees.

title: Enter at Your Own Risk
content:
Pros:Join, if you are the family member of MD.Cons:
No work-life balance тАФ expect to work weekends, holidays, and from home without extra pay.
HR & Admin are unprofessional and often rude тАФ no real policies, just favoritism.
Salaries are delayed or paid in parts тАФ never on time or in full.
Heavy nepotism тАФ key positions are held by family members regardless of skill.
Salary increments and performance reviews are either delayed for months or not done at all.
Advise to Management:Bring back the spirit Divine had before 2020тАФ when it actually felt like a place worth working for.

content: Bad management, I don't recommend anyone join the company.
