ржжрзАрж░рзНржШ рж╕ржорзЯредрзй.ржХрзЛржирзЛ ржмрж┐рж╢рзНрж░рж╛ржо ржирзЯтАФ ржмрж┐ржирзЛржжржи, ржирж╛ржорж╛ржЬ ржХрж┐ржВржмрж╛ ржмрж┐рж░рждрж┐рж░ ржХрзЛржирзЛ рж╕рзБржпрзЛржЧ ржирзЗржЗ, рж╢рзБржзрзБ ржХрж╛ржЬ ржЖрж░ ржХрж╛ржЬредрзк.ржЕржлрж┐рж╕ ржорж╛рж▓рж┐ржХрзЗрж░ ржорж╛ржирж╕рж┐ржХрждрж╛тАФ ржорж┐рж╕рзНржЯрж╛рж░ ржлрзНрж░рзЗржЬрж╛рж░ ржПржХржЬржи ржШрзЛрж╖рж┐ржд ржирж╛рж╕рзНрждрж┐ржХ, ржпрж┐ржирж┐ ржЖрж▓рзНрж▓рж╛рж╣ ржУ ржиржмрзАрж░ ржирж╛ржо рж╢рзБржирждрзЗржУ ржкрж╛рж░рзЗржи ржирж╛редрзл.ржЫрзБржЯрж┐рж░ ржЕржнрж╛ржмтАФ рж╢рзБржзрзБ рж╢рзБржХрзНрж░ржмрж╛рж░ ржЫрзБржЯрж┐, рждрж╛ржУ ржирж┐рж╢рзНржЪрж┐ржд ржирзЯред ржИржжрзЗрж░ ржЫрзБржЯрж┐ржУ рзй ржжрж┐ржирзЗрж░ ржмрзЗрж╢рж┐ ржкрж╛ржУрзЯрж╛ ржпрж╛рзЯ ржирж╛редрзм.ржХрзЛржирзЛ ржкрзНрж░рж╛ржХрзГрждрж┐ржХ ржжрзБрж░рзНржпрзЛржЧрзЗ ржЫрзБржЯрж┐ ржирзЗржЗтАФ рж╕рж░ржХрж╛рж░рж┐ ржЫрзБржЯрж┐, рж▓ржХржбрж╛ржЙржи, ржмржирзНржпрж╛ ржмрж╛ ржнрзВржорж┐ржХржорзНржктАФ ржХрж┐ржЫрзБрждрзЗржЗ ржЕржлрж┐рж╕ ржмржирзНржз рж╣рзЯ ржирж╛редрзн.ржмрзЗрждржи ржкрж░рж┐рж╢рзЛржзрзЗ ржХрзМрж╢рж▓тАФ ржорж╛рж╕рзЗрж░ рззрзж рждрж╛рж░рж┐ржЦрзЗ ржЖржВрж╢рж┐ржХ ржмрзЗрждржи ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗ, ржмрж╛ржХрж┐ ржмрзЗрждржи рззрзл-рзирзж рждрж╛рж░рж┐ржЦрзЗ ржжрзЗржУрзЯрж╛ рж╣рзЯред рж╕рж╛ржерзЗ ржмрж▓рзЗ, тАЬржПржЗ ржорж╛рж╕рзЗ рж╕рзЗрж▓ рж╣рзЯржирж┐,тАЭ ржпрж╛ ржЖрж╕рж▓рзЗ ржорж┐ржерзНржпрж╛редрзо.ржирж┐рзЯржорж┐ржд ржиржЬрж░ржжрж╛рж░рж┐ ржУ рж░рж╛ржЬржирзАрждрж┐тАФ рж╕рж░рзНржмржХрзНрж╖ржг рж╕рж┐рж╕рж┐ ржХрзНржпрж╛ржорзЗрж░рж╛рж░ ржиржЬрж░рзЗ ржерж╛ржХрждрзЗ рж╣рзЯ, ржПржмржВ ржЕржлрж┐рж╕ рж░рж╛ржЬржирзАрждрж┐ржУ ржХрж┐ржЫрзБржЯрж╛ ржмрж┐ржжрзНржпржорж╛ржиредрзп.ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖ ржЯрж┐ржХрзЗ ржерж╛ржХрзЗ ржмрж┐ржкржжрзЗ ржкрзЬрзЗтАФ ржмрзЗрж╢рж┐рж░ржнрж╛ржЧ ржХрж░рзНржорзА ржмрж┐ржкржжрзЗ ржкрзЬрж▓рзЗ рждржмрзЗржЗ ржПржЦрж╛ржирзЗ ржЯрж┐ржХрзЗ ржерж╛ржХрзЗред рждржмрзБржУ, ржЖрж╢рзНржЪрж░рзНржпрзЗрж░ ржмрж┐рж╖рзЯ, ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржмрзНржпрж╛ржЪрзЗрж░ ржЕржирзЗржХрзЗржЗ ржПржЦржирзЛ ржПржЦрж╛ржирзЗ ржХрж╛ржЬ ржХрж░ржЫрзЗредрззрзж.ржЕржлрж┐рж╕ ржорж╛рж▓рж┐ржХрзЗрж░ ржЖржЪрж░ржгтАФ ржорж╛рж▓рж┐ржХрзЗрж░ ржорж╛ржирж╕рж┐ржХрждрж╛ ржЕрждрзНржпржирзНржд ржирзЛржВрж░рж╛ ржУ ржирзЗрждрж┐ржмрж╛ржЪржХред ржЪрж╛рж░ржЯрж┐ ржЕржлрж┐рж╕рзЗ ржХрж╛ржЬ ржХрж░рж▓рзЗржУ ржПржоржи ржмрзНржпржХрзНрждрж┐ ржЖрж░ ржжрзЗржЦрж┐ржирж┐редрззрзз.ржжрзБржкрзБрж░рзЗрж░ ржЦрж╛ржмрж╛рж░ ржирж┐ржЬрзЗрж░ ржжрж╛рзЯрж┐рждрзНржмрзЗтАФ ржЕржлрж┐рж╕ ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржХрзЛржирзЛ ржЦрж╛ржмрж╛рж░рзЗрж░ ржмрзНржпржмрж╕рзНржерж╛ ржирзЗржЗред
рзз.ржнрж╛рж▓ ржХрж╛ржЬ ржУ рждрзЗрж▓ржмрж╛ржЬрж┐ ржХрж░рж▓рзЗ рж╕рзБржмрж┐ржзрж╛тАФ ржжржХрзНрж╖рждрж╛ ржУ рждрзЛрж╖рж╛ржорзЛржж ржерж╛ржХрж▓рзЗ ржХрж┐ржЫрзБржЯрж╛ ржЫрж╛рзЬ ржкрж╛ржУрзЯрж╛ ржпрж╛рзЯредрзи.ржирж┐рзЯржорж┐ржд ржмрзЗрждржитАФ ржЖржорж╛рж░ рж╕ржорзЯ ржмрзЗрждржи рж╕ржорзЯржорждрзЛ ржкрзЗрждрж╛ржо, ржПржЦржиржХрж╛рж░ ржЕржмрж╕рзНржерж╛ ржЬрж╛ржирж╛ ржирзЗржЗредрзй.ржХрж╛ржЬрзЗрж░ ржкрж░рж┐ржмрзЗрж╢ ржкрж░рж┐ржкрж╛ржЯрж┐тАФ ржкрзНрж░рждрж┐ржжрж┐ржи рзи ржмрзЗрж▓рж╛ рж▓рж╛рж▓ ржЪрж╛ ржУ рзз ржмрзЗрж▓рж╛ рзл ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛рж░ ржмрж┐рж╕рзНржХрзБржЯ ржжрзЗржУрзЯрж╛ рж╣рзЯредрзк.ржнрж╛рж▓ рж╕рж╛рж░рзНржнрж┐рж╕тАФ рждрж╛ржжрзЗрж░ рж╕рж╛рж░рзНржнрж┐рж╕ ржХрзЛрзЯрж╛рж▓рж┐ржЯрж┐ ржнрж╛рж▓ред ржмрж┐рзЯрзЗрж░ ржорждрзЛ рж╕рзЗржмрж╛рж░ ржЬржирзНржп ржЙржкржпрзЛржЧрзА рж╣рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рзЗредрзл.ржжрж░рзНрж╢ржирзАрзЯ ржУ ржорж┐рж╖рзНржЯржнрж╛рж╖рзА ржХрж░рзНржорзАржжрзЗрж░ ржЬржирзНржп рж╕рзБржмрж┐ржзрж╛тАФ ржЖржкржирж┐ ржпржжрж┐ рж╕рзБржжрж░рзНрж╢ржи ржУ рж╕рзБржирзНржжрж░ржнрж╛ржмрзЗ ржХржерж╛ ржмрж▓рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рзЗржи, рждрж╛рж╣рж▓рзЗ ржЕрждрж┐рж░рж┐ржХрзНржд рж╕рзБржмрж┐ржзрж╛ ржкрж╛ржУрзЯрж╛ рж╕ржорзНржнржмред
рж╕ржмржХрж┐ржЫрзБ ржорж┐рж▓рж┐рзЯрзЗ ржмрж▓рждрзЗ рж╣рзЯ, ржнрж╛рж▓рзЛ ржжрж┐ржХрзЗрж░ рждрзБрж▓ржирж╛рзЯ ржЦрж╛рж░рж╛ржк ржжрж┐ржХржЗ ржмрзЗрж╢рж┐ред ржЙржкрж░рзЗрж░ ржЕржнрж┐ржЬрзНржЮрждрж╛ ржЕржирзЗржХ ржкрзБрж░ржирзЛ, рж╣рзЯрждрзЛ ржПржЦржи ржХрж┐ржЫрзБ ржкрж░рж┐ржмрж░рзНрждржи ржПрж╕рзЗржЫрзЗред рждрж╛рж░ржкрж░ржУ, ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржкрж░рж╛ржорж░рзНрж╢тАФ ржПржоржи ржкрзНрж░рждрж┐рж╖рзНржарж╛ржирзЗ ржпрзЛржЧржжрж╛ржи ржХрж░рж╛рж░ ржЖржЧрзЗ ржнрж╛рж▓рзЛржнрж╛ржмрзЗ ржЪрж┐ржирзНрждрж╛ ржХрж░рзБржиред ржирзЯрждрзЛ, ржЖржкржирж╛рж░ ржЬрзАржмржирзЗ ржмрзЬ ржзрж░ржгрзЗрж░ ржирзЗрждрж┐ржмрж╛ржЪржХ ржкрзНрж░ржнрж╛ржм ржкрзЬрждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рзЗред

title: Very Cheap Mentality
content: Behaving like garments worker to their employees

title: Irregular Salary, No Job Security, and No Future Growth
content:
NEXT IT Limited is a highly disappointing workplace, and I strongly advise job seekers to proceed with caution. Although the company has been around for over 15 years, it has not secured a single external client. All work revolves around one internal clientтАФthe Managing DirectorтАФwho uses the company solely to support his own garments business. This severely limits professional growth, learning opportunities, and career advancement.
The salary disbursement is extremely irregular and unreliable. Employees often receive only 30-40% of their monthly salaries in partial installments spread across two or three settlements. In some cases, the company fails to pay the remaining due even after several months. Worse still, there have been instances where employees did not receive their pending dues after resigning, reflecting a serious lack of ethics and professionalism.
There is no job security, no clear career path, and no supportive work culture. Overall, the environment is unstable and demotivating. I would not recommend this company to anyone looking for a serious and respectful career opportunity.

title: Won't hire after internship
content: I, along with 14 others, attended their internship program last year. They had promised to hire at least 2тАУ3 people as full-time employees after the internship. However, they didn't hire a single person, despite our good performance. Later, we found out that they had used us to present a larger workforce to potential clients for a project that ultimately didnтАЩt materialize. As a result, they rejected all of us for full-time positions.

title: BJIT-ржП ржЗржирзНржЯрж╛рж░ржнрж┐ржЙ ржЕржнрж┐ржЬрзНржЮрждрж╛: ржХрж┐ржЫрзБ ржЧрзБрж░рзБрждрзНржмржкрзВрж░рзНржг ржкрж░рзНржпржмрзЗржХрзНрж╖ржг

title: UK Based Mula Business
content:
I have a long career journey. Throughout this journey, I have faced many ups and downs. When I joined this UK-based company, which is the parent company of Doctime (people don't recognize Media365 Limited, so they mention Doctime in job posts), I had a shocking experience just after joining!
I saw our CEO come from the UK and already fire more than 10 people тАФ and some were in the queue. Our CEO then arranged a meeting and described this situation as part of a business failure. He mentioned the word "cost cutting" around 100 times. So, instead of focusing on growth, this company continuously thrived on cost cutting and limiting budgets.
One of my junior colleagues who joined before me had his probation period extended. Another colleague didnтАЩt get the salary hike that was promised before joining. They set nearly impossible deadlines, assigned irrelevant tasks that didnтАЩt align with oneтАЩs responsibilities, and gave no appreciation for hard work тАФ a very common scenario here.
Our Project Manager / VP of Engineering operates the entire department from the UK. He doesnтАЩt have any idea about the complexity of any particular task. The only thing that matters to him is when the task will be finished. He also doesnтАЩt know the difference between complex and easy tasks тАФ and believes no task should take more than 2-3 days.
Sometimes, it seems he is completely a non-tech guy running the entire engineering department! These are the things I have experienced here.
It has some positive sides too тАФ unlimited coffee, snacks (cookies), healthy food for lunch (partially subsidized), evening snacks, a smiley tech lead (donтАЩt know whatтАЩs behind that smile, don't trust him, don't share your personal thoughts or plans with him, be very careful of him), football matches, annual tour, etc.
Note:They donтАЩt pay your bonus during the notice period, even if you are eligible after serving more than one year.

title: Avoid Hi Tech Bangla тАУ Terrible Experience
content:
I had a very disappointing experience with Hi Tech Bangla. The company operates in a highly unprofessional manner, with a chaotic and inefficient working process. The behavior of the CEO, Md. Harun, was especially concerning тАФ he often used inappropriate language towards employees, creating a toxic work environment.
One of the most unacceptable practices is their policy of withholding the last two months of salary if an employee decides to leave. This is both unethical and unfair. Overall, I would not recommend this company to anyone seeking a respectful and professional workplace.

title: Family-Run Business with a Tight Inner Circle. The company promotes a тАЬwe are familyтАЭ culture, but in reality, only care their family.
content: The company promotes a тАЬwe are familyтАЭ culture, but in reality, it heavily favors the owner's actual family and close friends. Key leadership positions are held by relatives (Co-Founder is the owner's spouse, CTO is the brother-in-law, HR Head is a sibling), and management is largely made up of personal acquaintances. This leads to a lack of transparency, limited opportunities for outsiders, and an overall unprofessional environment that can feel more like a daycare than a workplace. The culture feels restrictive and not open to diverse perspectives.

title: No one should accept their job offer
content:
Global Automation Ltd. is a medium-sized company in Bangladesh, specializing in manufacturing and supplying supermarket equipment, kitchen equipment, and food processing machinery. However, the company's work environment has significant challenges. The Managing Director often exhibits unprofessional behavior, including shouting at employees over minor issues. Additionally, the company frequently delays salary payments, leading to financial uncertainty for staff. These issues have resulted in high employee turnover, with many skilled professionals leaving the organization. While Global Automation Ltd. offers valuable products and services, addressing these internal management and operational concerns is crucial to improve employee satisfaction and retention.
Advice to Management
1. Foster a Respectful Work Environment: Cultivate a culture of respect and professionalism. Addressing employees with courtesy and avoiding public reprimands can significantly boost morale and productivity.
2. Ensure Timely Salary Payments: Consistently provide salaries on time to build trust and financial stability among employees, reducing turnover rates.
3. Implement Open Communication Channels: Encourage open dialogue between management and staff. Regular feedback sessions can help identify and resolve issues promptly, fostering a collaborative atmosphere.
4. Invest in Employee Development: Offer training and development opportunities to enhance skills and career growth, leading to increased job satisfaction and loyalty.
5. Recognize and Reward Contributions: Acknowledge and reward employees' hard work and achievements to motivate and retain top talent.
By addressing these areas, Global Automation Ltd. can improve employee satisfaction and retention, leading to a more productive and positive workplace.

title: Proper Example of Mula
content:
Akij iBOS or iBOS is basically an experiment project of Akij Resource MD Seikh Jasim Uddin. It's hardly got any business vision depite 3+ years operating. Started as a Software Development company but always afraid to work on any custom projects. There is no product manager but only interns and junior devs. Management does not guide or instruct on how to work but keeps pressuring for unrealistic expectations. Most of their client projects exceed delivery deadline that they cannot meet. How they treat employees?
1. You will be told about 2 weekends but all of a sudden you have to attend office on Saturdays for urgent work. Urgency? Nothing. Management wants you to come to office and have fun.
2. They terminate employees without notice for silly or almost no valid reasons.
3. When you will complain about workloads, they will recruit more interns instead of helping you with experienced resources. You will waste your working hours training them.
4. Most "urgent" works come from the group SBUs where you will be given the shortest deadline possible because "ржирж╛ ржХрж░рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рж▓рзЗ ржЪрж╛ржХрж░рж┐ ржерж╛ржХржмрзЗ ржирж╛"
5. Never say no to any work or they will be very angry. Just rely on ChatGPT or Gemini to get things done. They do not care the accuracy but it should be done.
6. ChatGPT is their lifeline. Every opinion you give from experience will be validated by ChatGPT and if GPT says you are wrong, YOU ARE DOOMED.
Don't fall for this. Better be unemployed than joining this torture cell.

title: Political enviroment
content:
Salaries are significantly below industry standards.
Extremely long working hours (often 14тАУ15 hours/day), with minimal respect for personal time.
Employees are expected to work during major life events (e.g., weddings, emergencies), including holidays like Eid.
There is no true work-life balance; employees must wait for higher-ups to leave even after completing daily hours.
Internal politics dominate decisions, limiting merit-based growth.
Technical skills are undervaluedтАФmanagement often claims that only 20% of growth is based on skills, and 80% on "communication" (a proxy for favoritism).
Favoritism and gender bias are common in promotions and rewards.
Employees focusing on technical excellence are often overlooked in favor of those who engage in personal networking.
Contributions by employees are frequently unrecognized, with higher-ups taking credit.
Mistakes due to vague instructions are blamed on juniors.
Employees are at times told to log work under someone else's account, hiding their contributions.
Opportunities for growth, skill development, or exposure to new technologies are severely limited.
Conversations and communications are heavily monitored.
Cross-team collaboration is discouraged.
Trust and autonomy are lacking, creating a suffocating work atmosphere.
Employees are pressured to attend expensive company trips at their own expense.
Non-participation is unofficially frowned upon and seen as career-damaging.
Tasks are often beyond job descriptions and pay grades, with no compensation or recognition.
Work-from-home flexibility is advertised but reserved for management.
Overtime and weekend work are common and unpaid, despite earlier promises of compensatory leave.
HR plays a disproportionately large role in technical decisions and employee management.
Initiatives to learn or grow are suppressed.
Developers are often stuck with repetitive tasks with no exposure to modern tools or frameworks.
The environment is not developer-friendly; developers are undervalued compared to non-technical staff.
The quality of product delivery is not a major concern.
The workload resembles a garments factory's more than a professional tech company.
Management practices are inefficient, chaotic, and demotivating.
Hard work goes unappreciated.

title: Dishonest, Cheap, Thief, Did not pay the due allowance
content:
My interaction with them was through an FTFL (Fast track future leaders) program, funded by World Bank. It was a paid┬а training program on cutting edge technologies. They somehow managed to get this project (with potential political connection back then).
They gave a lot less training allowance then was alloted to each trainee,
Did not use the budget alloted to buy equipments, Instead bought a very few cheap embedded devices,
Did not arrange the afternoon snack that was alloted in budget,
Did not pay full amount for all the months even (3 months allowance was supposed to be provided to us. Only 2 month allowance was given to some of the trainees. For other they used excuse like did not attend enough classes).
All-in-all, they were just in dhanda to steal from wherever they could.
Besides, the CEO misinformed and lied (vugichugi bujh) to us that it is a join venture, and we are kind of their employee,
and he her sister (who also worked there) treated us with rather harsh attitude.

title: How NOT to foster software engineers 101
content: My least favorite professional experience in life was at Bdtask as a fresh graduate. They objectively dangle delicious objectives leading to delirium but then you get seated in a room that persistently smells like poo owing to the poorly ventilated toilets less than 20 feet from the room where the seat the freshers and greenhorns. The dining room, also next to the toilets, often gets flooded with poo poo water, and while it sounds super childish and unrealistic, its 100% true and I hold a severe grudge against them for how they held me hostage for 6 months. The details, however, can not be divulged as it would give away my identity and endanger what little career I have left.The seniors act like insufferable little know-it-alls, closed off to any sort of mentoring but always open to pick a fight.Management treats employees like garment workers, requiring employees to clock out even if they leave the workstation for 5 minutes. I understand that company time is company time, but the company doesn't get to disguise a 9 hour work day into 10 hours by omitting lunch, prayers and miscellanous breaks. They say prayer breaks would be xenophobic (!) and lunch breaks are nonsensical because no two peope have lunch at the same time.So yeah that's that.0/10, would never recommend it/

title: Disappointed and burnt out
content:
Was excited to join but quickly realized the culture is not what they advertise. ItтАЩs all politics and optics.
Spent more time in justifying my work than actually doing any meaningful work.
Promotion process is a nightmare тАФ it's more about who advocates for you than what you actually contribute.
Manager barely knew what my team was working on and only showed up when upper management was watching.
Had to deal with passive-aggressive coworkers who smiled in meetings but blocked me in code reviews.
Overwhelmed with OKRs, performance trackers, and feedback cycles that felt more like surveillance than support.
The тАЬperksтАЭ are just shiny distractions to keep you at the office longer тАФ free food isnтАЩt worth the mental toll.
Burnt out within a year. Took me months after quitting to feel normal again.

18. тЭМ Toxic Politics & Poor Management тАУ Favoritism heavily influences promotions, with management lacking strategic vision. In one case, a female employee with no prior experience was promoted to head of a department in less than two years due to a personal relationship with the CEO, raising serious ethical concerns. тЭМ Unpaid Overtime Culture тАУ Forced to work overtime daily without pay (For some specific teams). Weekend work is paid only for 9 hours, despite some teams working 12-13+ hours. тЭМ Unrealistic Deadlines & Blame Shifting тАУ Poor project estimations result in impossible deadlines. Engineers are blamed for delays caused by managementтАЩs bidding tactics. тЭМ Employee Benefits Cut тАУ Free meals, Provident Fund, and service benefits have been removed without proper alternatives. тЭМ Low Salary Growth тАУ Increments are below industry standards, and the salary structure has barely changed in a decade. тЭМ Fear-Based Work Culture тАУ Raising concerns leads to retaliation rather than improvement.
19. Several key employee benefits (such as free food, Provident Fund, and service benefits) have been gradually discontinued over time. - The Provident Fund has been replaced by the Universal Pension Scheme, introduced without sufficient employee consultation or clarity. - Food quality concerns raised by employees were met with the discontinuation of free meals, rather than improvement efforts. - Year-end salary increments are not satisfactory, making it difficult to keep pace with industry standards and inflation. - The current salary structure appears to be outdated, with little revision in the last decade, which may affect employee motivation and retention. - Some management decisions seem to lack strategic depth, potentially contributing to employee dissatisfaction and missed growth opportunities. - Constructive feedback from employees has not been encouraged (they encouraged it, but the reality is different), and at times, raising concerns has led to negative consequences тАФ creating a culture where open communication feels discouraged.

If anyone can not do breakfast before the office time, during office time he or she is not allowed to do that. If she or he does this, this is not considered as good conduct 5. salary structure very low 6. No food facility 7. Senior management is very bad.

Most negative reviews come from former employees who were either fired or forced to resign, so most of the reviews are biased. - The company does let go of employees if needed, usually giving a two-month notice period before termination. - Common reasons for termination are; poor attendance, inappropriate behavior, or if the company is facing a project crisis. And project crisis happens a lot. - Some long-time employees become too comfortable, assuming they wonтАЩt be fired, so they avoid taking on new responsibilities or challenges. - Not all projects have the same workload, so while some teams have a smooth workflow, others might experience higher pressure depending on the project. - Job security depends on performance and company needs, which can sometimes create stress among employees.

Advice to Management
2. The company focuses more on giving benefits to a few selected individuals rather than building an employee-friendly culture. Career progression is heavily dependent on pleasing management rather than on actual performance. In the QA department especially, most team leads prefer not to work themselves and instead push the majority of their responsibilities onto junior team members.
